Alien ruins on Mars, SETI transmissions ...
Reviews of movies, books and online resources that add to the game

211122.name: Emily Is Probably Dead By Now
211122.description:
Emily Is Probably Dead By Now
A sinister game of bluffing and collusion for 4-6 players.

Gameplay begins with all players guilty of murdering Emily and hiding the body.
Everyone at the table is guilty and is looking for a way out.
Each player begins with pieces of evidence that they must stash in order to get away with murder and win the game leaving the other players to waste away behind bars.

During each round of the game players will play location cards face down claiming that they are helping the town search party look for the "missing" Emily. The rest of the group needs to decide if you are actually checking a location or trying to stash evidence when nobody is looking.

If you get caught hiding evidence you will gain suspicion which will make it more difficult to get rid of your current evidence and if you are caught trying to collude with other players you will gain additional pieces of evidence.

Ok.....so get rid of evidence that's it right? It can't get much worse then committing a murder and having evidence on you as you help search for the missing person. Well that is true until one unlucky player ends up actually picking up Emily and must now get rid of this very damming piece of evidence .
If any player is caught with Emily's body the game immediately ends and that player will receive the death penalty while all other players will serve jail sentences based on how much evidence they currently have in their hand.

Game Highlights

Bluffing
Bluffing and hiding your true intentions is the heart and sole of this game. The mechanics were developed to not get in the way or hinder your ability to bluff your way through a tough situation. There are situations in the game that will test your metal and challenge your ability to maintain a convincing deception.

Collusion
Players will have opportunities on the fly to quickly decide to work with each other to get further in the game but beware there can only be one winner and colluding with others carries a much higher penalty and invites a firm back-stab from savvy players looking to catch you off guard.

Quick Game Play
Emily Is Probably Dead is very quick to learn and each game takes about 20-30 mins to conclude. Making this a perfect filler game to play in between other games or as a quick fun gaming experience with very little time commitment.

A New Twist On the Who Dunnit Theme
"So who dunnit?"......"You all did!" now its a question of who is going to get caught and who is going to get away with murder!

211123.name: Death in the Wood
211123.description:
A Triple Kingdom Adventure

From the introduction:

The Bell Wood has always been rumored to be a dangerous place, full of strange creatures and odd happenings. Timber from the wood is highly sought after for its reputed magical properties, so brave foresters sometimes dare the wood to harvest trees to finance their futures.

But this time, people are dying. Loggers are vanishing, their mutilated bodies recovered from the undergrowth hours or days later. What has changed in the wood? Can anyone solve the mystery? And can they survive the investigation?

A 3–4 hour adventure for 4–5 characters of 1st level.

211125.name: Owroboros
211125.description:
From the introduction:

Find out if you have what it takes to lead.

User summary:

This rules-light, amusing LARP is presented in a very idiosyncratic style. The game deliberately was submitted anonymously.

211126.name: The Life and Death of Stars
rpg: The Life and Death of Stars
211126.description:
From the introduction:

In The Life and Death of Stars each player portrays one of David Bowie’s performance personas, representing aspects of the artist’s psyche upon the moment of his passing. The larp functions as both a tribute and an exploration of mortality.

211127.name: Warning! Death or Serious Injury Can Occur
rpg: Warning!  Death or Serious Injury Can Occur
211127.description:
A Game Poem about Parenting Advice

From the introduction:

This game focuses on the contradictory and dire warnings that current and prospective parents receive from various sources: friends, family, books, and blogs. Using parody to defuse the power these warnings hold over both parents and non-parents, game play should evoke laughter, but should also open a space to examine this advice with a critical eye. You do not need to be a parent to play this game.

211128.name: Coma Ward
211128.description:
Sterile, blinding whiteness — coupled with deafening, repetitious beeps — shocks you awake. Your heart rate slows and your breathing steadies as you realize you are in a hospital. You glance around, finding your room empty. You read your identifying armband to see a name you don't recognize. As your bare feet smack to the cold tile floor and you steady your wobbling body, you feel the foreign presence of absence. You are alone…

In Coma Ward, players are patients who have awoken in an abandoned, yet still functioning hospital with no memory and no idea of what is happening. Patients must search the hospital for clues and necessities. In their search, patients may find unspeakably terrifying things.

Each time you play, you explore an ever-changing hospital as you search for the clues to your identity and the cause of the environment's unsettling emptiness. Balance your ever worsening terror and neurosis while monitoring your health and physical attributes. Remember to stay close to those who awoke with you because the shadows of the empty hospital can destroy your already fragile psyche. Once all the clues have been discovered, the true horror begins. Players discover what is actually happening and find out who they can trust — if anyone — and how to win.

Each playing is a unique phenomenon that introduces diverse and dynamic rules. Coma Ward is a mature game with themes of violence, absolution, distrust, gore, and traumatic incidence. Player discretion is advised.

Coma Ward plays in two parts:
The Prologue:

Patients will move through the Hospital discovering new Tiles that represent rooms. Some Tiles will affect a Patient’s Health or Terror. Other Tiles will impact the game in other unpredictable ways.

While they explore and search, Patients will discover items that will help them in their frantic search for answers. Items like Clothing and makeshift Weapons will defend you from unseen forces or even other hostile Patients. While Medicine and Food can restore your Health and Focus. Ultimately, Patients are searching for the horrific Clues to what has happened in this hospital. Once all of the Clues have been revealed, the true game objective unfolds…


The Phenomenon:

Upon uncovering the final Clue, the Phenomenon is triggered. Players will then withdraw and open the specified sealed envelope from the box revealing its secret contents telling the story of what is happening and how to win the game.

Some Phenomenon are cooperative, with players racing to escape the hospital or defeat cruel forces. While other Phenomenon will pit players against each other in secret alliances or an all out fight for survival.
Each Phenomenon can lead to multiple endings. So, even if Players reveal the same Phenomenon multiple times, they will always have a unique experience.
Some Phenomenon are physical, real, threats inspired by classic horror tropes; others explore metaphysical and psychological themes…

Are you ready to open your eyes and experience the phenomenal horror of Coma Ward?

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211129.name: Ship of Fools
211129.description:
A One Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Knavery may be the best defense against the knave; but in Rhynehurst, where the gutters have so often flowed crimson with the blood of thieves beset upon thieves, the varied shades of gray result in a situation where “good” is only relative to what one considers “evil”.

A roguish adventure for [character levels] 2 to 8, and the first adventure in the “Fools” trilogy.

211130.name: GooCubelets: OCD
211130.description:
User Summary

Another installment of the GooCubelets Series with 50 new puzzles.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211131.name: Dwarven Dawn
211131.description:
A One Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

You receive word from Thuldon Rockspitter that now is the time for all friends of Clan Rockhall to assist in an important quest…or at least time for some friends of Thuldon to do him a very big favor. All he asks you is to find a dwarven druid known as Rukar and escort him to Clan Rockhall. Starting at Loren’s Ford, any group of adventurers worthy of their name should be able to find a confused dwarf. How hard can it be?

A scenario for [character levels] 2 to 12.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211132.name: A Fool's Errand
211132.description:
A One Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

In Verbobonc City public speakers have begun preaching hate and fear: turning man against gnome. A feeling of apprehension grows with each passing day. Like the fields during a drought, everyone is waiting for either the roaring of a fire or the cool spattering of rain.

A Verbobonc regional scenario for lawmen or lawbreakers, [characters level] 2 through 10.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211133.name: Reunification
211133.description:
A One Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Earth and Stone, Man and Gnome. In Verbobonc, it has been man against gnome since the Kron Hills Revolt of 588 CY. But with the common giant foe resurgent, it is time for the revolt to end. It is time for reunification. Through word and deed, Verbobonc will regain the allegiance of the gnomes.

An adventure for [characters level] 10 through 16, with both diplomatic and combat elements.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211134.name: Beauty and Two Beasts
211134.description:
A One Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Lady Asbury asks for help from those that have helped her before. She has an important decision to make and she dare not make it herself. Her taxes did not make it to the Viscount so she must make other arrangements. She must barter the only thing of enough value that she possesses. She must marry, not for love, but for financial reasons. But which suitor will she choose?

A Verbobonc Regional adventure for [characters level] 6-12.

211135.name: Wicked Three
rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211135.description:
A One Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A dryad in the Gnarley Forest has learned a powerful prophesy that speaks of the evil operating in the Viscounty. She seeks an escort away from her home, so she can give the prophesy to an old friend... Viscount Langard.

A one-round adventure for [characters level] 2 to 8.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211136.name: It's Never That Simple
211136.description:
A One Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Introductory Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Verbobonc City seems an excellent place to purchase new supplies and find companions before striking off in search of adventure. Yet with the harvest just finished the city is packed full and finding a room is harder than you imagined possible. Well, with the rash of thefts you've heard about, perhaps that's just as well. Wherever you sleep you should keep one eye open.

A Verbobonc Regional Introductory Scenario for 1st-level characters only.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211137.name: Joren's Tomb
211137.description:
A One Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Introductory Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

In years past, a gnomish warmaster rose up to command a force and defend his town, friends, and homeland from an invading army of giants. So complete was the victory that it took over three-hundred years for the giants to regain their former strength. Now, the warmaster’s descendant seeks help in locating his final resting place so that the besieged gnomes of today might regain a sense of pride and rally against those who have occupied their homeland. The warmaster’s name was Arund Joren. The resting place – Joren’s Tomb.

A Verbobonc introductory regional scenario for first-level characters only.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211138.name: Sewer Rats
211138.description:
A One Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Introductory Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Verbobonc City seems like great place for you to earn some much-needed coin, but you have been having no luck finding worthwhile employment. As such, you take what little jobs you get, even if that includes catering.

A Verbobonc Regional Introductory Scenario for 1st-level characters only.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211139.name: Seen and Not Seen
211139.description:
A One Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Introductory Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The town of Taymouth is buzzing with rumors of mysterious disappearances along a rarely traveled road in the Gnarley Forest. Investigation only leads to more secrets. A mysterious group of people living in the woods and a noble’s caravan converge at a campground along the road. The night will not pass uneventfully.

An Introductory regional adventure for 1st level characters only.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211140.name: Deep in the Lortmils
211140.description:
A Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The journal of a long-dead dwarven surveyor in Irondelve holds the clues to locating the last key needed to open the gates of Granite Keep. Thuldon Rockspitter requests the aid of those true to Clan Rockhall so this final piece may be recovered and the gates to Granite Keep opened at last.

An adventure for [characters level] 4 - 12.

Recommended for those who have played VER1-07: Knocking on the Keep, VER2-02: Granite Keep, VER3-06: Never Read Somebody’s Diary, VERS4-01: Return to the Fens of Tor, and VER4-05: Dwarven Dawn.

211141.name: Fallen Hero
rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211141.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Old Baron Rollof Avgustin returned from fighting in Veluna a hero, but old men do not live forever—even war heroes. A few nobles and adventurers have been invited to Avgustin’s manor house near Loren’s Ford to witness the Baron’s funeral. Not all guests wish House Avgustin well in this sad time; an enemy is in your midst. No character with Infamy with House Avgustin may play this scenario.

Recommended for characters that have played VER3-04 A Matter of Love and VER4-09: Wicked Three.

A one-round adventure for [characters level] 4 to 12.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211142.name: Minions of Shadow and Fire
211142.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The culmination of the Dwarven story arc, this is a combat-laden Verbobonc regional adventure for character levels 2 to 14.

Characters with the Distrust of Clan Rockhall, the Curse of Moradin, or the Disfavor of Clan Rockhall cannot play this adventure.

It is strongly recommended that the character play the previous adventures in this series prior to playing this adventure.

User summary:

This scenario was distributed as two files - a 36-page PDF scenario file and a 3-page PDF player handout entitled The Journal of Grimbold Ironshanks.

211143.name: The I of the Dragon
211143.description:
You, the player, take the role of the young, inexperienced dragon. In the role of the savior of Nimoa you move through the skies and faces all the challenges of the evil Skarborr.

At the beginning of the game the player has the choice of three dragons: Annoth The Fire Breather, Barroth the magician and Morrogh The Necromancer. All three are different and all three have their own ways of dealing with the great many adversaries you will meet. You also develop the dragon's combat abilities throughout the game to deal with the increasingly tough and resilient enemies, until you meet and conquer Skarborr himself.

That is not all, you will also need to control other characters and complete important tasks on the path to overall victory: a warlord and his steed on a potentially fatal fact finding mission, the thoroughly competent hunter on a mission of delicate accuracy and selective killing and the three huge creatures and their riders in an attempt to destroy magical generators keeping the dragons away from the next big fight.

Through 12 enormous and differing geographical areas the task is not only to hunt and destroy despicable monsters, but to build, maintain and defend human settlements. A dragon's individual character, breathtakingly fluid graphics and addictively exhausting aerial combat bring you many hours of sometimes sweat generating gameplay.

You will also fall under the spell of "The I of the Dragon" with its mystical atmosphere, impressive sunrises and colorful but ominous sunsets, for who knows what the night will bring.

Source: The Game Website.

211145.name: Pre-Civilization Egypt
211145.description:
Pre-Civilization Egypt is a turn-based strategy built on the history of Ancient Egypt. Starting from 5000 B.C. you will guide the Egyptians through all the hardships to prosperity and power. Get ready to march into faraway lands, fight catastrophes and hardships. The game covers almost 2000 years of Egyptian Pre-Dynastic history, starting from the dawn in 5000 BC till the Early Dynastic Period in 3100 BC. As the right hand of the ruler, you will control the life of Ancient Egypt – manage resources, assign workers, build new districts, temples and palaces.

Source: The Game Website.

211146.name: Four Suspects
boardgamepublisher: テンデイズゲームズ (Ten Days Games)
211146.description:
One murder. Four Suspects. And everyone claims to have an alibi.

Four Suspects offers 30 minutes of deep deduction. Each of four suspects claim to have been at a certain location at a certain time, and each alibi is represented by a card. At the beginning of the game these 16 cards are shuffled and one is put away. This is the missing alibi that needs to be identified, and the remaining cards are divided between the players.

Players takes turn choosing one of three available interrogation cards from the middle of the table. The chosen card lets you ask one other player for information about their cards. Questions are in the form of "How many cards do you have showing either the park or the shopping mall?", "How many cards do you have showing the young woman?", and so on.

In a 2-player game each has two hotel rooms with 3 or 4 guests. All questions only concern the occupants of one room.

Each time a player is asked a question they receive 1 coin. Coins can be used to hire the help of assistants, which provides special abilities, like the ability to lie, to avoid showing cards, take another turn and so on.

This coin mechanism balances a problem of many deduction games, that the player being asked more questions are generally at a disadvantage. The assistants also make sure the players have to combine different kinds of information while trying to deduce the missing alibi, making "4 suspects" a challenging game for deduction game lovers.

The game components are language independent.

211147.name: Fields of Green: Kickstarter Promo Cards
211147.description:
These cards and tiles were available as Strech Goals during the Kickstarter campaing, but are also available as purchase later on.

This expansion includes:
- 5 Open Area placeholders
- 8 Early Planning cards
- 16 Event cards
- 1 rule card for the above 2
- 24 location cards (3 locations of every type)
- 8 Equipment tiles (2 of each: Chainsaw, Pipes, Scarecrow, Baskets)

All the cards of this expansion are marked with a small cow symbol in the lower right corner.

211148.name: Carillon
211148.description: In Carillon, you buy bells from a workshop to build a carillon, and as in Coloretto, players either set a card on a workshop or gain all cards — but gained cards are set into a particular form, so collecting only cards of the same color is not the best way to play.

211149.name: Noxford: Essen 2016 promo card
211149.description: Extra red syndicate Master card that can be used as a replacement for the default one.

211150.description:
Promo expansion for Dice Stars originally sold with the base game at Essen 2016.

It adds 7 planets, 3 of which are chosen before the game, these can be claimed by any player upon completing a column and then used for a special one-per-game ability
211150.name: Dice Stars Planets

211151.description:
Promo expansion sold with the base game originally at Essen 2016.

Anyone eliminated by a Snitch takes a Wanted by the FBI card. The player who has the most cards cannot win the game. If you have wanted cards and are the snitch for a round, you can put all of your money back into the reserve to get rid of all your Wanted cards
211151.name: Millions of Dollars: Spotted by the FBI

211152.name: Country of Morvaen
211152.description:
From publisher blurb:

The God's Light Went Out

The god of the night sky, HIM, has left us. In the vacuum has come the fires of the reborn Vord King, sending the country into anarchy. Son against brother, father against sister, the land burned. Only a threat from the outside, the hated wolf-soldiers of Hyrkhalla, sewed the wounds of our country together before it hemorrhaged to death. We rise again, a phoenix at dawn break, our wish to be anew relighting us.

We Will Not Be Stopped

The country of Morvaen was originally found in the World Book of Khaas, Legendary Lands of Arduin. This expanded version has more grit and detail than the original, as well as associated material appropriate for the Arduin Eternal® game system, published by Emperors Choice Games & Miniatures®.

211153.description:
Promo character card for Harbour. Double-sided, with English on one side and German version 'Klaus - Heiliger aus'm Norden' on the flip side.

Ability: Whenever any player uses the home building of the player with Klaus as a character, collect any 1 resource.

The promo character Klaus is included in the German magazine "Spielerei" issue no. 113 (Oct.-Dec. 2016)
211153.name: Harbour: Klaus – Saint of the North

211154.name: Gemstones & Art Objects (5E)
211154.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your PCs are deep in the dungeon and have just defeated a terrifying dragon! As they bandage their wounds, and ready their fallen friend’s bodies for return to the surface, they look around and ask “So what treasure’s in the dragon’s hoard, anyway?” At that point, unless the GM has prepared a detailed list of treasure, the PCs get (possibly) literally tons of coins and some generic magic items. (After all, most GMs have better things to do with their prep time than generate descriptions for stuff the PCs will likely sell).

Treasures & Trinkets: Gemstones & Art Objects banishes these problems by presenting scores of bespoke art objects and detailed gemstone notes ready for use in virtually any GM’s campaign.

This book is designed for use with the 5th edition of the world's most popular role-playing game.

211155.name: Gemstones & Art Objects (System Neutral Edition)
211155.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your PCs are deep in the dungeon and have just defeated a terrifying dragon! As they bandage their wounds, and ready their fallen friend’s bodies for return to the surface, they look around and ask “So what treasure’s in the dragon’s hoard, anyway?” At that point, unless the GM has prepared a detailed list of treasure, the PCs get (possibly) literally tons of coins and some generic magic items. (After all, most GMs have better things to do with their prep time than generate descriptions for stuff the PCs will likely sell).

Treasures & Trinkets: Gemstones & Art Objects banishes these problems by presenting scores of bespoke art objects and detailed gemstone notes ready for use in virtually any GM’s campaign.

211156.name: The Midnight Market
211156.description:
From publisher blurb:

Astride a deep chasm separating the world of light from the eternal dark of the Ebon Realm, the Midnight Market is a place where the denizens of both worlds meet and trade in relative peace and harmony. Watched over by its vain, but merciless, mistress bloodshed is expressly forbidden within its bustling halls. Here dark-skinned drow, gruff duergar and humans from the surface realms mingle with even more exotic or distasteful folk including both those of unknown origins and the undead. For those who can curb their revulsion or violent tendencies toward those with whom they deal, the Midnight Market is a place where almost anything can be had…for a price…

211157.name: Noisome Beasts
211157.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Pages for Shadow of the Demon Lord!

Monsters possess a wide range of abilities with which they can terrorize their enemies, from claws and fangs to spells and supernatural powers. Noisome Beasts explores some of the more famous breeds of monster to infest the lands of Rûl, specifically those that are noxious and toxic to creatures around them. In the following pages, you’ll find new lore, illustrations, and variants of the amphisbaena, basilisk, catoblepas, cockatrice, and the manticore. Written by game design Robert J. Schwalb and lavishly illustrated by Jack Kaiser, this installment of Monstrous Pages throws open the doors to the most noisome monsters known on Urth!

211158.name: Dead by Dawn: Adventure Conversion Guide
211158.description:
A 3-hour adventure conversion for 3rd level characters

From the introduction:

Dead by Dawn is an adventure written by Aeryn Rudel for Dungeons & Dragons (4th Edition) and published in Dungeon (Issue 176 - Mar 2010). It is a horror-themed adventure where the PCs hole up overnight in an evil temple while undead hordes attempt to break in.

Please note: This is not the full adventure text. This is a conversion guide that allows one to run the adventure as it appears in Dungeon (Issue 176 - Mar 2010) with Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition) rules.

211159.name: Guilds of Aden
211159.description:
From publisher blurb:

United we stand!

The world of Aden is a dark and dangerous place, and there are many who lack the strength and the skill to survive on their own. Fortunately for them, there are still organizations that have survived in the years since the Darkfall and can provide the strength that others lack, although such a thing always comes at a price. Every guild, every society, every clique has its own agenda, and these groups are no different. Whether the price of survival is worth it is a decision that each member must make on their own.

In this book you will find extensive information on:

The Ancient & Intrepid Cartographer’s Society
The near-mythical Crimson Sisterhood
The sinister Grey Masters and their necromantic secrets
The extinct Heralds Guild
The noble Justicars of Yzeem and their honorable mission
The ruthless Scavengers and their morbid mechamagical methods

211160.name: Horror Feats P-S
211160.description:
From publisher blurb:

Horror Feats P-S is the latest Mythic Mini devoted to exploring the terrible tricks that desperate heroes and vile villains alike might unleash in a horror-themed campaign using the new Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Horror Adventures rulebook. Whether they deal in blood, pain, death, plagues, curses, corruption, sinister sorcery, or the mortal and immortal soul, these enhanced feats will dial up the horror in your campaign to a diabolical degree! Open up sinister secrets and skills aplenty in this PDF of 7 new feats from Protector of the People to Skin Suit and all feats in between, including truly nasty tricks like Sacrificial Adept and Purging Emesis!

211161.name: The Great Plagues
211161.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Here you will find a few samples of plagues (two historical, one fictional classic) to give color and a macabre atmosphere to your campaign.

These diseases aren't to be treated lightly, and they aren't just a screw-job for the characters, but campaign hooks and adventures by themselves.

211164.name: Cry Havoc: New Orders
211164.description:
This mini expansion for Cry Havoc brings new ways to score points and therefore increases number of available strategies players may follow in their games.

To use this expansion, take 2 Objective cards for each Terrain type and shuffle them to appropriate Terrain Tactics deck. There cards become part of each deck.

When player draws Objective card, he shows it to every player and put it face up next to the board. Then he draws another card.

All face up Objective cards are considered in play. At the end of the game, during the Final scoring each of these cards must be resolved and player who meet requirement is awarded with Victory Points. If two or more players meet requirement, they all are awarded victory points.

--

This extension was given with pre-orders of Cry Havoc at Spiel'16.

Includes 8 objective cards, 2 for each Terrain type.

211167.name: Game of Defense: Atlantic
211167.description:
This checkers-type naval wargame covering the Atlantic Ocean theater was published in 1941 as simply Game of Defense. After the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor late that year, an Atlantic sticker was added to the box, and a companion board covering the Pacific Ocean was published, using the same parts box but with a Pacific sticker added.

The Atlantic map is a red-and-white checkerboard with green land areas drawn on the eastern and western edges. Five ports are circled on each side: Scapa Flow, Brest, Lisbon, Gibraltar and Dakar on the Europe/Africa side, and Halifax, New York, Charleston, New Orleans and Panama on the Americas side.

Each side gets four each of three types of ship: battleships move 1-4 squares only on red; cruisers move 1-3 squares on white; and submarines move a single square without restriction. Battleships and cruisers destroy opposing ships by jumping over them (and can jump over a square of opposite color to do so), while submarines kill by moving onto another ship.

At the beginning of the game, each player draws one of five Objective cards naming a port on the opposite side, and also writes down 10 numbered squares (of 50 on the board off both coasts) as secret minefields. Players move alternately, either a single ship or up to 5 ships on adjoining squares as a fleet move. If a ship moves onto or over a minefield, a card is drawn from the deck showing the consequences.

The winner is the first to have the stated number of ships reach shore at that player's Objective.

boardgameintegration: I Can't Even With These Marvelous Supers
I Can't Even With These Spectacular Supers
I Can't Even With These Marvelous Supers
I Can't Even With These Spectacular Supers
211168.description:
I CAN’T EVEN is a series of card games that all share one rule: The player with the highest odd score wins! For example, if the game ended with players at 9, 16, 20, and 22 points, the player with 9 points would win! Each game is standalone or can be shuffled together.

'I Can't Even With These Monsters has 49 monster cards: Amalgam, Blob, Ghost, Ichthid, Mummy, Vampire, Werewolf, each appearing seven times.
211168.name: I Can't Even With These Monsters
boardgamefamily: Guild: Game Designers of North Carolina

211169.name: Battles of Black Cavalry: 10 Cavalry Brigade/1 Armoured Division from Poland to Wilhelmshaven
211169.description:
Next game in a 'Great Battles of Small Units' tactical system.
8 September, 1939. Commanded by Colonel Maczek 10 Motorized Cavalry Brigade fights from 1 September against two German divisions 2nd Armoured and 4th Light. During the retreat towards the river San brigade occupies its own garrison city of Rzeszow. The attack of the German 4th Light Division is stopped, the brigade moved 15 kilometers to the east, where 9 September occupies the city of Łańcut (garrison of one of its regiments, 10th Mounted Rifle Regiment. This leads to the subsequent fighting, the brigade again stops the Germans. Two battalions each against three German motorized battalions and reconnaissance regiment. Polish brigade receives but unexpectedly artillery support, and every time had four artillery batteries, of which one heavy. Polish artillery is thus much weaker than the German.

211171.description:
A promotional card given out during the 2016 Essen Spiel conference by G@mebox. Later available as part of a draw, entry by commenting on the G@mebox website guestbook.

This promo introduces a new key Building Card that you can use in the game. The building card enables you to recruit a new character for free at the end of the round, when the card is added to your village. This card has a one-time effect, and can't be used in subsequent rounds.

The G@mebox unicorn logo is depicted on the red banners of the building.
211171.name: Above and Below: G@mebox Building promo card

211172.name: Envoyer (Issue 20 - Jun 1998)
211172.description: Issue 20 contains news, reviews, various articles, and some system-neutral gaming content.

211173.description:
Originally included in the 2016 Boardgame Advent Calender this expansion consists of 4 tiles themed around gift giving. When a player uses one of the included tile, each other player gets a little gift from the supply.

Contents:
1 cloud tile
1 forest tile
1 mountain tile
1 hill tile
211173.name: Broom Service: Christmastime

211174.description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2016 for Day 7.

Contains two new guild tiles, both of which give random 1st and 2nd place reward tokens in addition to allowing the master to choose which guild symbol they are when resolved.
211174.name: Guilds of London: Cheese and Papermakers Promo

211175.description:
Undermine is an easy-to-learn resource management & worker placement game. Each set adds 2 more players to the game.

The goal of the game is to operate mines, play the Equipment cards for the right investments and thus try to be the first player to reach 7 points.

Gameplay:
Players take turns investing in Investment Cards with their 2 Diamond Tokens. After all players make their investments, the Collection Phase begins. In this phase the players collect the income for their investments from the bank, while returning the used Diamond and Miner Tokens to the bank. When the collection is complete, a new round begins. The game continues this way until the sum of a player's Equipment Card points equals 7.
211175.name: Undermine

211176.description:
Originally included in the 2016 Boardgame Advent Calender this promo includes a Healing Fountain tile and 2 Green Portal Exploration tokens, as well as the rules necessary to use them.

Setup

Shuffle both Green Portal tokens with the other Exploration tokens from the base game and place them face down on the board following the instructions of the scenario.

Place the Healing Fountain secret room tile next to the board.

Rules

When a Hero reveals one of the Green Portal tokens, it is flipped face up and stays on that Space. The Green Portal token can never be collected.

Green Portals work like the standard Portals in the game. Characters can spend one Movement Point to move from one Green Portal to any other Green Portal, whether it's to the Healing Fountain secret room, or to the other Green Portal Exploration Token (if it's been revealed).

Each time a Hero or a Pet enters the Healing Fountain secret room, they may heal 1 Wound and unexhaust 1 card of their choice.
211176.name: Arcadia Quest: Healing Fountain

211177.name: Odyssee (Issue 2 - Mar 1997)
211177.description: The second issue contains a range of articles, news, reviews, a system-agnostic fantasy scenario, and some shorter materials for Midgard and ERPS.

211178.name: Crazy Karts: Accelerators
211178.description:
A set of 4 cards (one for each faction) which can either provide one steering wheel to power an action or (when played in a specific slot) add an additional effect.

Mummies: If placed on the Lasso action, you may move 1 obstacle in your shooting range, 1 space in any direction.

Dwarves: If placed on the Ram action, you don't stop on the first obstacle you hit this round.

Goblins: If placed on the Turn & Go action, you may Turn at any moment during your movement.

Elves: If placed on the Power Up action, you may activate a second Power Up token this round.

211180.name: Black Stories: Promostory "An der Leistungsgrenze"
211180.description:
This is a promotional Black Stories given out for free at the publisher's booth at SPIEL Essen 2016.

It will be contained in the upcoming Black Stories Strange World Edition. Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddlestories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.

The promo story can be played on its own, without any actual Black Stories edition.

211183.name: Spexxx: Extension
211183.description:
This extension contains 19 tokens to place random on the board. By rolling the dice combination of a square holding a tile, you directly collect the advantage of the token.

The tokens allow either a special action to (re)move a cube, block a square on the board, gain an additional roll or score immediately extra points without requiring to have a spexxx.

A 20th token allows to change the scoring table by changing the number of points scored for either the orange or purple squares.

211184.description:
This is an expansion for the Joking Hazard game, and was included in the Joking Hazard Kickstarter campaign.

This 50 card booster includes all your favorite jokes, especially ones about World War 2.
211184.name: Joking Hazard: Blast From The Past

211186.name: Omni Link
211186.description:
Omni Link is a different kind of visual novel featuring space exploration, real-time combat, and choices that affect gameplay and story. Find love across the stars and learn what it takes to give everything you have for those you care about.

Source: The Developer Website.

211187.name: DOPAMINE
211187.description:
DOPAMINE is a competitive high-speed action shooter in VR. Fly, boost-dash, and use your beams and homing lasers to rack up your points!

Source: The Developer Website.

211188.name: Super Hop 'N' Bop ULTRA
211188.description:
Super Hop 'N' Bop ULTRA is a 1v1 arena game with fast paced skill based action. The game hearkens to gameboy action platformers, while still feeling fresh and exciting.

Source: The Developer Website.

211189.name: The Whisperer in Darkness
211189.description:
Rumors resurface. Legends are resurrected. In this Lovecraftian visual novel, play as Alex N. Wilmarth, skeptic and professor at Miskatonic University, to unravel the hideous secrets centered at a secluded farm in the hills of Vermont, coming ever closer to mortal peril.

Source: The Developer Website.

211190.name: True Fear: Forsaken Souls
211190.description:
User Summary

True Fear: Forsaken Souls is a psychological thriller.

211191.name: Maelstrom's Edge
211191.description:
Description from the publisher:

Maelstrom's Edge is a tabletop war game using detailed plastic miniatures that fills the gap between small scale skirmish games with several individual models per side and large scale war games with scores of models per side. Maelstrom's Edge uses about 20 to 30 models a side, making it easy to model, easy to paint and easy to play. Forces consist of several small-sized units, which is why we call the game a 'squad-based skirmish game'. Because it is a miniatures game, you get to assemble and paint your own models to pit against an opponent on a table dressed up with terrain to form your battlefield.

The conflicts on your table take the form of missions set in the desperate Maelstrom's Edge universe, populated by the Epirian Foundation and their robotic forces, the secretive Karist Enclave supported by the alien Angels, and various other factions. The content below highlights our game, background and models, and how you can get started.

211192.name: Grav Lab: Gravitational Testing Facility and Observations
videogamehonor: 2016 Proto Awards Best Educational Experience Nominee
211192.description:
Grav|Lab is a physics and electronic circuit puzzle game for the HTC Vive and Oculus Touch. Solve puzzles in many different ways and create new ones with the included level editor.

Source: The Game Website.

211193.name: Stalker Outsiders
211193.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world's most famous fantasy role-playing game has a huge monster book, but many creatures we loved in prior editions were overlooked. The 5e Fiendopedia brings some of these back and updates them for the 5th edition rules.

This PDF includes 7 fiends and aberrations: Barghest, Greater Barghest, Bebelith, Gloomwing, Tenebrous Worm, Wendigo, and Yeth Hound.

Each creature gets a full-color image, 5th edition statistics & abilities, and background/ecology information.

211194.name: Inquisitor Spells VI (3PP)
211194.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Inquisitor Spells is a simple document that collects the inquisitor spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 6th-level inquisitor spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and from select third-party products.

211195.name: Inquisitor Spells VI (PRD)
211195.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Inquisitor Spells is a simple document that collects the inquisitor spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 6th-level inquisitor spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

211196.name: Witch Spells VIII (PRD)
211196.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Witch Spells is a simple document that collects the witch spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 8th-level witch spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

211197.name: Witch Spells VIII (3PP)
211197.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Witch Spells is a simple document that collects the witch spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 8th-level witch spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

211198.name: Weresheep
211198.description:
From publisher blurb:

Weresheep of the Apocalypse

You've heard of black sheep? These are way nastier, true Weresheep of the Apocalypse, dread creatures that are summoned on the darkest nights to bring terror and havoc to decent people of the shire.

Baa at the Moon, brothers, the end times are nigh! The weresheep ride beneath a blood-red moon!

211199.name: Am I Lion?
211199.description:
Am I Lion? is a "take that" bluffing game that takes place on an African Savannah. Each animal has a special power that will affect the winner and loser of each round.

The base game comes with 8 different animals with special powers. The winner is the first to get rid of their hand of cards or players can be eliminated by gaining a herd or obtaining an African menagerie.

The winner of each trick gets to perform an action related to the animal they bluffed with.

Am I Lion? Am I Giraffe? Only those that bluff the best will know.

211200.name: White Ape of the Congo (FATE)
211200.description:
From publisher blurb:

1936: A note and a bit of map leads a group of explorers into the Congo in search of a lost biologist and the mythic White Apes of Africa!

Written as a stand alone adventure, or for an ongoing pulp campaign, the adventure This adventure is compatible with Spirit of the Century, Atomic Robo, and other Fate systems. Designed for two to six players, the adventure includes pre-generated characters.

211201.name: Hellweg Westfalicus: Doppeltes Einkommen
211201.description:
Hellweg Westfalicus: Doppeltes Einkommen (double income) is a postcard mini-expansion for Hellweg westfalicus.

The postcard says:
Add the new Merchandise Card "Double Income" to play.
The owner of the card needs also the "+1" card of this kind. Every time he must remove a Carriage from the game and take it back into his Supply, he receives two Thaler instead of one from the Bank.

211202.description:
Ctrl+Alt+Del has quite a history. It was a pioneer in web comics with 14 years of regular updates. It was an animated series. It has spawned a generation of memes that will forever grace the internet. And now... It's a tabletop game. Oh snap!


Working together with Tim Buckley, Killer Robot Games is proud to present Legendary Showdown: Gamer's Quest.

You don't need to be familiar with Ctrl+Alt+Del to enjoy Legendary Showdown.

In Legendary Showdown: Gamer's Quest each player uses strategy, sabotage, and one-upmanship to develop a secret battle plan.

In Legendary Showdown, each player controls a line of characters. At the end of the round, the characters at the front of each line fight. Players use cards to rearrange their line and the lines of other players to change which characters will compete. Characters can be strengthened (or sabotaged) with special bonuses, weapons, and secret facedown cards. Action cards can be used to employ numerous strategies and keep your opponents guessing. The round suddenly ends when enough players pass, and the strongest front character wins the round! All of the other front characters are discarded, and the last player standing wins.
211202.name: Legendary Showdown: Gamer's Quest

211203.name: MetRum
211203.description:
MetRum is a rummy-style card game where the cards are London Tube stations. The aim of the game is to collect melds (sets) of stations either on the same line or all on different lines. The first player to play 5 melds and go out by having no cards left in their hand wins.

The majority of the cards are connection stations (stations on multiple lines) and single-line stations. There are also ghost stations (representing stations no longer in use) and driver cards which are wild and can count as any station.

Whenever you play a meld, you can either swap a card or take a card from an opponent's hand depending on the type and number of melds played.

211205.description: Alternate art/sex promo characters for Asylum, Under the Mask, The Marcy Case, A Prophecy of Dragons. Stretch goals from TIME Stories Polish crowdfunding campaign on Wspieram.to page. Polish edition by REBEL.pl. Art by Jarek Nocoń.
boardgameaccessory: T.I.M.E Stories: A Prophecy of Dragons
211205.name: T.I.M.E Stories: Alternate character art pack

211211.name: Flipover
211211.description:
"A Game of Memory and Strategy for Two To Four Players"

Flipover is a memory game for 2-4 players. Players take turns rolling
dice and flipping over numbered tokens. The goal is to flip tokens
that add up to the sum of the dice. Players that succeed keep all
tokens flipped during their turn; if a player fails any flipped tokens are flipped back over, allowing players to remember their location.

Players can challenge the player to their left to flip tokens adding
to a target number - the winner of the challenge keeps all tokens
flipped. Play continues until all tokens have been removed from the
board. The player with the most tokens wins.

The Flipover board is an 8x8 grid. Each circular token is colored
black on one side with a number from 2-6 on the other side. The game
uses two six-sided dice.

211212.name: Bearly Working
211212.description:
Welcome to your City! As the newly elected Mayor it is your duty to attend and bid at a 5 day bear auction in hopes of creating a prosperous society with a diverse workforce. Watch out though because you’ll be facing rival Mayors with the same objective! Bearly Working is an “auction-based card collecting game” where the end goal is to have more points than your opponents while managing your resources wisely. Develop your city by purchasing bears with special skills and hire covert criminals to sabotage your opponents! Whatever your strategy…

Running a city is grizzly business!
--
This is an auction based game for two to four players and takes around 20 to 30 minutes to play.
The game lasts 5 days and each day is broken into 3 phases.
The first phase is the auction, where you will face off against the other mayors in an open bidding system. One by one, a bear is showcased and then auctioned off. The winning bidder hires the worker into their city. The second phase is payday. There are two types of bears. One provides victory points and the other provides income. Mayors with income bears in their city will collect their total pay check from the bank. The third phase is the action phase. Mayors will have three opportunities to either collect five coins from the bank or enlist the help of criminals.

These crooks will be essential in sabotaging your competition. They do devious things such as fixing the auction, stealing some money or kidnapping bears.At the end of the third phase, the day is complete and this cycle is repeated for a total of 5 times. The player with the most victory points at the end of the game, is the winner!

211213.name: Triathlon Series
211213.description:
You are an amateur triathlete struggling to find the time for training and steady your mental and energy state to be as ready as you possible can for the race.

The game-flow is divided in two big areas. A card management phase where you need to develop technical skills of swim, bike and run but still maintain a good level of energy and mindfulness just before the race. After this phase, the first dice based triathlon split will occur, followed by another management phase giving you the time to adjust your strategy before the next split.

211214.name: Toxic Mayhem: The Troma Project
211214.description:
Toxic Mayhem is the exciting action/strategy video game which puts you in the world of Troma! Featuring The Toxic Avenger, Sgt. Kabukiman N.Y.P.D. and Super Tromette Tiffany Shepis, Toxic Mayhem is the fun and addictive game which allows players to mindlessly kill anything and everything that moves! And, at the beginning of every mission, Lloyd Kaufman will give you advice on how to get through it!

Source: The Publisher Website.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211215.name: Fool's Gold
211215.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Bridgeforth Inn stands quiet and empty; speakers no longer preach the Brotherhoods message to the populace of Verbobonc City. But all is not well; Bub Tympanum is still missing, Uncle Vardis still has not been apprehended, and none who have entered the Bridgeforth have lived.

For both lawful and chaotic [player characters], this Verbobonc regional adventure is for character levels 1 to 14 and the final adventure in the “Fools” series.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211216.name: A Swan-Like End
211216.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Get ready for an explosive time in the town of Swan! You have been invited to attend the memorial for the legendary Hero of Verbobonc, Willow Swan, which will feature the dedication of a new statue carved in his likeness. Of course, plans made in Verbobonc rarely go as predicted. Soon enough, the party is knee deep in adventure searching for statues, assassins, and the source of all the friction between the Verbobonc nobles.

A light-hearted Verbobonc regional adventure designed for [characters level] 6 - 12. Players should bring their sense of humor.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211217.name: On the Viscount's Secret Service
211217.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

An unusual request, a secret meeting, and a hamlet that isn't on any maps. You've been selected to assist in investigating just what has the Church of Saint Cuthbert worried... and the Viscount thinking there is something far more sinister going on.

An adventure for characters level 10 to 17.

[Player character] combatants that are members in Verbobonc regional meta-org's, or who are mercenary in nature, are highly recommended.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211218.name: Crown Fire
211218.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A surprising turn of events in Cienega Valley sparks far more than expected as the final stroke of a master plan takes shape. The fires of destiny herald the coming of the end and at long last, a pale hand stretches forth. A raging conflagration scourges the land and it’s a race against time to save all from the coming storm.

This is a two-round Verbobonc regional adventure for character levels 2 to 14, and lead-in to the interactive conclusion: March of the Giants.

It is strongly recommended that characters that have played previous adventures significant to the Verbobonc story line prior to this adventure.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211219.name: Roses are Red, Violets are Blue
211219.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

Romance and danger, fathers and daughters, bitter betrayals and dramatic reunions, with a tomato thrown in somewhere. Who could resist?

A sap happy four hour Verbobonc introductory scenario for 1st level characters only.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211220.name: A Debt to Pay
211220.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

You’re only running a simple errand, so what danger is there?

A Verbobonc Regional Introductory Scenario for 1st-level characters only.

211221.name: Galaxy of Trian
211221.description:
Galaxy of Trian is a dynamic, turn-based strategy board game. Its fast paced, tile-based mechanics gives players unique experience. It is simple yet allows for multiple strategies and tactics.

Source: The Game Website.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211222.name: Ruby Falls
211222.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

Rumors speak of a ghost who gives out rubies. Is this true or just a gnomish prank? A merchant is looking for adventurers to find out this answer.

This is a two-round Verbobonc Introductory regional adventure for first-level characters only.

211223.name: Lance A Lot
videogamehonor: 2016 Swedish Game Awards Gamers' Choice Winner
211223.description:
RUIN FRIENDSHIPS. ON ROCKETS. Challenge your friends to a GLORIOUS tournament of rocket jousting! Up to 4 players can fight each other locally – but only one will be left standing when the dust settles.

Source: The Developer Website.

211224.name: Batman: Return to Arkham
211224.description:
The most critically acclaimed superhero games ever made - Batman: Arkham Asylum and Batman: Arkham City - rebuilt for next-gen in one amazing bundle.

Source: The Game Website.

211225.name: Tactical Firefight War on Terror: Mission 1 OEF
211225.description: A new tactical Wargame in which players will experience the hardships of modern combat like never before. Unlike the wars of the past the War on Terror has been against an enemy that is all but unseen, he wears no standard uniform and doesn't comply with the rules of war. Tactical Firefight has captured the essence of the nature of combat during these turbulent times. In the game one player will play Coalition Forces while the other player will be playing the insurgent forces. Contained in the first installment of the Tactical Firefight Series are missions from Operation Enduring Freedom(OEF). The US lead invasion of Afghanistan in 2001-present. Gameplay will involve a scenario deck in which the Coalition player draws a card from his/her scenario deck. Reveals this to his/her opponent and set up the game likewise for that scenario. As well as these scenario cards. Once the mission is set up each player will then draw a card from their respective objective decks. For the insurgent player this objective is secondary to stopping the Coalition player from achieving the mission goal. So for the Coalition player this objective is secondary to the overall mission. If these objectives are completed during the game however will affect the amount of victory points at the end of the mission. Tactical Firefight will also be able to be played solo with just as much depth as when playing against an opponent.

211230.description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is a set of minimaps for players to use to plan and execute their routes.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.

There are also spanners along some tracks which may help or hinder you. The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but there are some options in the spanner pack.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn extra points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
211230.name: Belarus (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

211233.description:
Promo card for 3 Wishes, that was given out at Spiel '16 with a purchase of the base game. Counts as 4 points in yellow suit.

Setup: Shuffle More Genies! into 3 Wishes. Place 3 cards face down in the middle instead of 2.

Ability: Ignore the ability and points of your Super Power card at the end of the game.
211233.name: 3 Wishes: More Genies! Promo Card

211234.name: Alchemist Extracts III (PRD)
211234.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Alchemist Extracts is a simple document that collects the alchemist extractlist, and all extracts in it, for easy use. The extract lists are broken up by level and school, and the extracts of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 3rd-level alchemist extracts.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

211235.name: Alchemist Extracts III (3PP)
211235.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Alchemist Extracts is a simple document that collects the alchemist extractlist, and all extracts in it, for easy use. The extract lists are broken up by level and school, and the extracts of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 3rd-level alchemist extracts.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

211236.name: Albarrana
211236.description:
Description from the designer:

Albarrana is a late medieval castle building game played with building blocks. The game rules are freely distributed for anyone to share. While designed for 2 to 4 players, it can be played with more as long as there are enough blocks available. After three rounds of building and fighting with rival castles the winner is the player with the largest and greatest castle with the highest towers.

During building a random card determines the block every player gets to place next to their castle. There's a push your luck mechanic in that the players should complete the castle before a dice roll ends the building phase after 8 to 13 cards.

The fighting is asymmetric so that the defender is basically choosing which attackers to target and tries to score high enough dice throws, while the attacker is able to choose where he moves his troops and if he wants to try to conquer the castle to get a block for himself or simply wreck parts of the defender's castle. Conquering is achieved by reaching a flag inside the castle.

Actual victory points are calculated after the third battle by adding the squared height of the towers to the castle area.

211237.name: The Weeping Glass
211237.description:
From the introduction:

A little lore, a lot of gore...

In The Weeping Glass, the characters happen to be in the wrong inn at the wrong time. An elven troublemaker plays with a power beyond her control and releases a horrific wave of death. The characters have to fight through a grindhouse to stay alive.

This encounter is designed with options to kill* a party of 4 from levels 1 – 11.


*Total Party Kill is not guaranteed.

211238.name: Anachrony: Doomsday Enhancement Pack
211238.description:
The Doomsday Enhancement Pack is a promotional deck of ten cards for the "Doomsday" Module of Anachrony.

It was first released at SPIEL '16, ahead of the release of the game itself.

211239.name: Becoming a Scientist at Gopher Tortoise Elementary School
rpg: Becoming a Scientist at Gopher Tortoise Elementary School
211239.description:
User summary:

The game rules are presented in Role-Playing in Science Education: An Effective Strategy for Developing Multiple Perspectives, published in Journal of Elementary Science Education, Vol. 21, No. 3 (Summer 2009), pp. 33-46, Western Illinois University.

The goal of the game is to enable a classroom facilitator to lead role-play sessions focused on scientists and how they perform the scientific process. Students in the classroom create characters that are scientists. Focus should be given to developing character backgrounds that are not stereotypical and character interests that are broad and divergent. Character creation is presented as a solitaire assignment prior to the roleplaying sessions.

During play, students are encouraged to use costuming. Play sessions use the fictional setting of Gopher Tortoise Elementary School. During the live-action play sessions, the instructor assumes the role of scientific facilitator and leads a series of seminar discussions. The introductory scene is presented as The Oprah Show and involves an extemporized concise interview of participants. Later scenes involve direct interaction and spontaneous discussions among players. The concluding scene involves a group presentation to the assembled faculty of Gopher Tortoise Elementary School where the faculty is instructed in the nature of science and the scientific process.

211240.name: Tiny Epic Western: The Tycoon
211240.description:
New boss card

Text reads:
At the end of phase four gain XX if you did not buy a building card at any point in the round.

"Rough times at the table? I've got an ace what ails ya."

211241.name: Archimedes's Law at Gymnasium
211241.description:
User summary:

The live-action role-playing game is presented in Journal of Science and Arts, Year 10, No. 1(12), pp. 175-182, 2010, in Role-Playing as a Creative Method in Science Education. The article describes several methods of implementing aspects of role-playing in science education. One method enumerated involves an actual live-action role-playing game where the instructor and students all assume the roles of participants in a Greek gymnasium where the relative merits of the "new" Archimedes's Law (buoyancy and displacement) are presented, discussed, discredited, supported, and otherwise examined in a manner consistent with the general practices of gymnasium. It is assumed the LARP will last for about 45 minutes. A discussion of outcomes of actual LARP sessions is included.

211242.name: Nuclear Winter
211242.description:
From publisher blurb:

A powerful Russian aristocrat seeks to return his Motherland to the time of the Tsars, at any cost. By acquiring a specific Faberge Egg, he intends to plunge the world into a new Ice Age. Can the heroes discover his plans and stop him before the glory of the Tsars returns?

211243.name: Country of Falohyr
211243.description:
From publisher blurb:

A vibrant monarchy.

Rich feudal lords with an eye towards destiny. A vast economic and political destiny. No matter what the cost. No matter what must be cast aside: history, racial pride, negotiated borders, or even truth. Not that everyone agrees. The migrant Elven nobles, the Nexus Wars 3000 years fresh in their minds could not be farther from agreement. They, and those who suffer from this unspoken accord act in opposition, and keep alive a quiet but powerful rebellion.

Where will you fall?

Whose side will you take in the future years as destiny is carved from blood, ambition and in the eyes of Amarydion, patron goddess of Falohyr?

The country of Falohyr was originally found in the World Book of Khaas, Legendary Lands of Arduin. This expanded version has more grit and detail than the original, as well as associated material appropriate for the Arduin Eternal® game system, published by Emperors Choice Games & Miniatures®.

211245.name: Fat Food
211245.description:
You like to eat a good meal? You are one of those who can't stop eating until you see the bottom of the plate? Then, it's time for you to test your taste in this new delicious competition!

Fat Food is a competitive cardgame for 3 to 6 players to see who becomes the Greater Glutton of Vicinity!

Each player must help assemble and eat dishes of various tupes of foods using bluff and putting your heart in the hands of luck!

Fat Food is a party game light, fast, fun and greasy, where each player must eat all he/she can or die trying. Literally.

There are 3 types of cards in Fat Food: Healthy, neutral and unhealthy food. Each card has the amount of grams that the player gets after eat it and the heart symbol indicate whether those foods harm your health or not (+1 for healthy foods, 0 for neutral foods and -1 for unhealthy foods).

Each player, in his/her turn, can add a open card of food over a dish or eat a dish (Stoping playing until all the other dishes are eated).

The game ends when one player reach -5 hearts (and suffering a heart attack!). Win the one who accumulate the highest amount of grams ingested.

211246.name: Tower Two
211246.description:
Extracted from the rule book:

"Tower Two" is an abstract strategy board game for two players. You move from dot to dot, horizontally or vertically only, defeating opponent's soldiers (by placing two of your soldiers surrounding one of the opponent's), trying to place two of your soldiers over the opponent's towers.

There's two zones per player ("Trenches" and "Front Line") and one common zone ("Battle zone"). You spend 3 actions of:
- move a soldier to an adjacent empty dot (horizontally or vertically)
- move a soldier from "Trenches" to "Front Line"
- move a soldier from "Front Line" to one of your Towers (if it's empty)

You must spend all actions unless you win before the end of your turn.

211248.name: All Men Must Die
211248.description:
Publisher Blurb:

All Men Must Die is a short hack for Undying that adapts the RPG for gritty medieval fantasy in the manner of the Game of Thrones TV show. Turning the player characters from politicking, bloodthirsty vampires into politicking, bloodthirsty monarchs is surprisingly straightforward. Or maybe it's not surprising at all.

211251.name: Horns of Borsala
211251.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sheevus are mating...

During the great rains when the Sheevus mate in the basalt bones of the earth the Horns of Borsala rise to pierce the watery mantle of the Stormy Sea off the Knuckle Bone island. They shine in the moonlight and if a man be lucky enough to find the right moment between death and destruction to find the calm they can make port on its brine salted side and take for themselves the bounty of pearls and plunder claimed by Borsala in the last nine cycles past.

Don't wait - grab this to satisfy your GM needs!

This one page dungeon is a collaboration between the Michael Prescott and Monty St John.

rpgseries: A World of Adventure for Fate Core System
211253.name: Loose Threads
211253.description:
From publisher blurb:

On the edges of fairy tales live members of the Company — collateral damage from someone else’s Happily Ever After.

Maybe their fairy godmother got lost on the way, or they failed to solve the riddle, or their siblings forgot to save them before riding off into the sunset. Now Company members live on the edges of tales and travel the In-Betweens, helping others like them who need rescuing from ogres, reversing of curses, and freedom from the evil clutches of bandits. People who the stories have forgotten. It’s difficult work, and every story must end eventually.

How will yours turn out?

Will you be a dashing damsel, a prince in distress, a charming witch, or something else new and interesting that breaks the mold? Find out in Loose Threads by Tara Zuber.

Loose Threads requires Fate Core to play. This 42-page supplement includes:

New aspect categories, including the Heart’s Desire, to create characters worthy of a fairy tale
A scaled tension aspect that allows characters to slide between two dueling ideas, states, or desires
A system for fairy tale favors — a new kind of boost
Ideas on how to create a fairy tale story in a non-traditional setting like a space station or a high school
A phase trio character creation adventure — Mr. Fox — and a sample adventure — Pecked to Death




Everyone has a tale to tell in Loose Threads. What's yours?

211254.name: Rescue Love Revenge
211254.description:
An Episodic Retro Indie Three-Act Spaghetti Western Platformer.

Source: The Game Website.

211255.name: Shift Orb
211255.description:
User Summary

Shift Orb is an indie physics puzzle game.

211256.name: Crazy Machines 3
211256.description:
Crazy Machines 3 is the latest, greatest, most amazing and craziest part of the series and fascinates once more with physic-based puzzles.

Source: The Game Website.

211258.name: Pair Throw
211258.description:
A strategic press-your-luck game of rolling dice for points.

The name is derived from the old Norse word "perthro", which means "dice cup", and is also the focus of the game: rolling (throwing) dice to get pairs of numbers.

Players roll 9 dice, set aside any matching pairs they want to keep, and then re-roll the remaining dice. Points can only be scored for pairs of numbers, and pairs must be formed on the same roll. If no pairs of numbers are rolled, the turn ends and the dice are passed to the next player.

Scoring can quickly get intense, as multiple pairs of the same number are worth bonus points, and getting 4 pairs plus a matching number on the "extra" dice allows players to re-roll all 9 dice again.

When a player earns a total score of 500 or more, all other players get one last turn to try and get enough points to surpass that score. Once all players have received a final turn, the player with the highest score is the winner!

211259.name: Summa Summarum
211259.description:
Summa Summarum is a card game about speculating and calculating.

Players secretly bet on sums that will occur on 4 edges of a central card. Then they by turn play cards with numbers to the edges or corners of the card.

The player with the lowest total difference between his bets and the sums at the corners wins.

211261.name: Red Dead Redemption 2
videogamehonor: 2016 The Game Awards Most Anticipated Game Next Year Nominee
211261.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

Red Dead Redemption 2 is the sequel to Red Dead Redemption.

211262.name: Save Innsmouth
211262.description:
Publisher Blurb:

You’re all students at Arkham’s renowned Miskatonic University. Between terms, you’re taking the opportunity to go hiking. You’ve taken an interest in the newspaper and local TV reports of construction in the north-east, along the coast, that will see a piece of history, a town preserved since Prohibition times, bulldozed to make way for a luxury health spa resort. This will be the last chance to see the place intact before The Man clears away another chunk of America’s heritage in the name of progress.

This Cthulhu Hack adventure is designed as a stand-alone scenario and can be run as a one-shot adventure over a single sitting from three to four hours of real time. It makes an ideal adventure for convention play or as an introduction to The Cthulhu Hack system.

Suitable for any modern day game system of investigative horror.

211263.name: Army Lists 3000BC - 1250AD
211263.description: Army lists for use with WRG wargames rules, with lists for 48 ancient armies.

211264.description:
Description from the designer:

In Apocalypse Frenzy, aliens have come to destroy the world in a humorous way! Let cats take over the Earth for example, or cover the planet with lava. Players have a secret alignment card that determines whether they want to destroy the world or protect the world from destroyers. Complete missions and play cards to earn points, but beware: both the missions and the card values depend on your alignment. Each player plays one of four unique characters, each with their own special abilities and even their own cards. If you don't have the cards you need, you can trade, but remember: lying about the cards you want to trade is allowed...
211264.name: Apocalypse Frenzy

211265.name: Watch Ya' Mouth: Family Expansion #1
211265.description:
Description from the publisher:

Did your family play the heck out of the Watch Ya’ Mouth base game, so your kids recite our funny phrases by heart? No problem! Watch Ya Mouth Family Expansion Pack #1 replenishes your repertoire with plenty of fresh phrases for extended kid-friendly gameplay.

Watch Ya’ Mouth, The Original Mouthguard Party Game, is authentic and hilarious. Often imitated, never duplicated.
3-10 players
Hampered by cheek retractors, teams attempt to read and interpret silly phrases, like:
A belligerent bison is on the boardwalk!
Mother baboon and her fluffy babies.
Playful porpoises surfing waves.
Watch Ya Mouth Family Expansion Pack #1 comes with 155 family-safe, family-fun phrase cards and 6 blanks (161 total cards). Our cards are strong, thick, and durable for years of sticky-fingered quality time.

211266.name: Watch Ya' Mouth: NSFW Expansion #1
211266.description:
Enjoy our thick, dirty, long-lasting…phrase cards. (Why, what did you think we were going to say?) Get your mind out of the gutter and our cheek retractors into your mouth. C’mon, the kids are asleep. Put Watch Ya Mouth NSFW Expansion Pack #1 deep inside your cart. Warning: may be too intense for some players. Can you handle it?

Watch Ya’ Mouth, The Original Mouthguard Party Game, is authentic and hilarious. Often imitated, never duplicated.
3-10 players
Hampered by cheek retractors, teams attempt to read and interpret silly phrases, like:
Mother f∪©k!ng penguins.
Pop my butt pimple.
Bubba Gump is a backdoor bandit.

Watch Ya’ Mouth NSFW Expansion Pack #1 comes with 143 depraved, explicit phrases. Our cards are strong and durable for years of hysterics and beer spills.

211267.name: Watch Ya' Mouth: NSFW Expansion #2
211267.description:
Description from the publisher:

If the first time only left you wanting more, we’re always DTF. Let’s do it again, bae. Take your oral game to the next level. Order Watch Ya Mouth NSFW Expansion Pack #2 right now. You know you want to. Warning: if the first NSFW expansion pack grossed you out, then it’s time to accept that you are, in fact, only safe for work. Loosen that tie, let down that hair, and play on, playa.

Watch Ya’ Mouth, The Original Mouthguard Party Game, is authentic and hilarious. Often imitated, never duplicated.
3-10 players
Hampered by cheek retractors, teams attempt to read and interpret silly phrases, such as:
Beer tastes like barley and b∪tth0le.
Butt plugs for the whole family.
Funky fart fumes!

Watch Ya Mouth NSFW Expansion Pack #2 comes with 155 depraved, explicit phrase cards and 6 blanks (161 total cards). Our cards are strong, thick, and durable for years of hysterics and beer spills.

211268.name: Watch Ya' Mouth: NSFW Expansion #3
211268.description:
You just can’t get enough, can you? Let’s invite more people to join in. Do you think your friends are game? Let’s watch them make asses of themselves. Take pics. Post publicly. Tease mercilessly. Look cool. Warning: Watch Ya Mouth NSFW Expansion Pack #3 is not responsible for any social media beefs. #SorryNotSorry

Watch Ya’ Mouth, The Original Mouthguard Party Game, is authentic and hilarious. Often imitated, never duplicated.
3-10 players
Hampered by cheek retractors, teams attempt to read and interpret silly phrases, like:
Wonder Woman wears super panties.
The brew pub is in the village.
My husband wears a mankini for fun.

Watch Ya Mouth NSFW Expansion Pack #3 comes with 155 depraved, explicit phrase cards and 6 blanks (161 total cards). Our cards are strong, thick, and durable for years of hysterics and beer spills.

211269.name: Shattered Dreams (W20)
211269.description:
From the back of the book:

The Wars of Rage

In the mists of prehistory, the werewolves worked alongside the other Changing Breeds to safeguard Gaia against the many threats to Her existence. The werewolves' pride and their great Rage drove them to murder their cousins, leaving two Changing Breeds extinct and Gaia's children forever broken. Millenia later, the twin lures of colonialism and conquest once again brought the shapeshifters into conflict leading to the death of the Camazotz. Nobody knew quite what happened to spark the Wars of Rage, or what life was like when the Changing Breeds worked together, until now.

The Past Laid Bare
