Shattered Dreams presents and in-depth look at the prehistory of the Changing Breeds, including both the threats they had to face before circumstances drove them to war and the War of Rage itself. Rather than one answer, it showcases many time periods and many ways in which the War could start, so that players and Storytellers can make prehistory their own. It also presends circumstances surrounding the Second War of Rage, giving players the chance to take part, either as Garou Conquistadores or as the Fera desperately trying to fight off an invasion. Finally, the included chronicle structure allows modern characters to visit these cruciall moments of history in an effort to stop the Wyrm's most powerful minions.

Shattered Dreams contains:


The first ever look at the World of Darkness before the War of Rage.
The ways the Wars of Rage could start, and how enterprising characters could change what happened.
Two chronicle frameworks that bring modern characters to the ast, replete with new Abilities and new Storytelling tools that make the players the center of much larger stories.


Shattered Dreams is a non-canon exploration of a wild and crazy vision of the ancient past of World of Darkness.

211270.name: Infinit-O
videogamehonor: 2016 IndieCade Best Visual Design of the Year Winner
211270.description:
User Summary

Dreams is a video game that will be on display as part of the exhibition, Let Power Take A Female Form. The video game is a conceptual portrait on the life & influence of three generations of women artists, Eugenia Butler, Eugenia P. Butler, Corazon Del Sol. The central character is a pair of three legs that navigates a series of planetary vignettes, with theme elements that oscillate between absurd dreaminess and narrative vehicles that explore the archetypes of woman-hood.

211271.name: We Are Chicago
211271.description:
We Are Chicago is a first person narrative-driven adventure game that strives to portray the harsh realities of growing up on the south side of Chicago. You are thrown into the life of Aaron in the week leading up to his high school graduation when your best friend Robert suddenly stops showing up to school.

As your world is unraveling around you, it's becoming increasingly difficult to protect your family and loved ones among all the turmoil facing your neighborhood.

Source: The Game Website.

211272.name: You Must Be 18 or Older to Enter
videogamehonor: 2017 IGF Awards Best Student Game Honorable Mention
211272.description:
You Must be 18 or Older to Enter recreates the feeling of being a prepubescent kid looking at porn for the first time. Through interactive fiction elements combined with ASCII styled art, ‘You Must be 18 or Older to Enter’ blurs several genres together to create an anxious experience. It is akin to horror yet the fear is of being caught by parentals and being embarrassed of looking at the human body. The ASCII art makes the images hard to read close up, making the player embody a child-like role. Audiences at farther distances will be able to see the pictures more clearly, casting them in the role of adults.

Source: The Developer Website.

211273.name: Sins of the Father
211273.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Today is the day you find out that your soul was sold long before you were born. Now it’s time for you to continue the legacy your family has held for generations in service to the Dark Lord. This quirky RPG is filled with dark humor and devilish depravity, as every character sets out to fulfill their Debt and explore what makes a person good or bad. Are you forever destined to be a minion of hell?

Sins of the Father takes players down a dark path and focuses on how the Seven Deadly Sins can become warped. It features a simple-to-use, card-based resolution system that allows for flexibility and focuses on the story.

Includes:


All rules needed to play the game
Several sample Dark Lords and playtable characters
Unique system utilzing playing cards.

211274.name: Das Katastrophenspiel
211274.description:
Das Katastrophenspiel is a quick card game for 2 to 5 players.

In Das Katastrophenspiel players are taking up the roles of heroic helpers of an unspecified European disaster relief organization. The objective is to provide world-wide aid, but only one group within the organization can attain the highest decoration. Who saves mankind?
Source: Publisher's website

The players have a start team, with people and equipment; using the abilities for the team the players travels to one a catastrophe in the world and manage them; these could be fires, earthquakes, refugees, droughts, floods, and more.
The players gain money for a successful mission, which can be used to buy better equipment or team members. The harder the mission is the more money and/or Victory Points the player gets.

Most VP after eight rounds wins the game.

211275.description:
The CoolCats & AssHats Extreme NSFW booster pack is a perfect addition for when you really want to dial up the party.

Cards are uniquely designed so players know they're in for an extremely aggressive task.

Just mix it in with your regular CoolCats & AssHats game and check your morals at the door.

Don't worry, you probably won't remember tomorrow anyway.

Order now on Amazon: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01GN79Y4G/ref=as_li_qf_sp...
211275.name: CoolCats & AssHats: Extreme NSFW Booster Pack

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211276.name: The Discontent of our Winter
211276.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A missing food shipment, a noble ambition, and strife in the Viscounty lead to a chilly reception in the town of Ketter’s Hearth. A thief is in custody, but is he responsible for the crime? That’s what you’ve been sent to discover.

This is a one-round Verbobonc regional adventure for [character] levels 1-8.

Recommended for members of the Mounted Borderers, The Family, and the Verbobonc Town Project (Ketter’s Hearth).

211277.name: Nanooborg
211277.description:
User Summary

You manuever a robot past hazards without touching the walls. The trick is that the directional buttons to navigate the robot are reversed up/down and right/left.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211278.name: The Discontent of our Winter Errata
211278.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

User summary:

Three pages of errata and corrections for the scenario.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211279.name: Delve the Wizard's Dungeon
211279.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

One of Verbobonc’s notable eccentrics asks you to take a quick trip to an abandoned library and pick something up he left behind several years ago. You’re off on the road to adventure!

This is adventure 1 of 5 in the Skyroad Series, which should be played in order.

A one-round adventure for [first level characters].

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211280.name: Delve the Wizard's Dungeon Errata
211280.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

User summary:

Three pages of errata and corrections for the scenario.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211281.name: Castle Estival
211281.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Castle Estival has sat looming over the Ironwood. A dark and ominous place shunned by many, though a few have dared to enter... only never to return. For almost two centuries it has stood as a lasting reminder of keoish occupation, a testament to the iniquitous and cruel ways of a long gone noble house. Will you explore past its walls, for you have been asked to delve into its secrets.

A two-round adventure for character levels 1 to 14.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211282.name: Castle Estival Errata
211282.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

User summary:

Five pages of errata and corrections for the scenario.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211283.name: Sign of the Black Orchid
211283.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Does the good of the many outweigh the justice of one? Are you willing to brave the murky depths of politics to service the greater good? As sins of the past threaten to tear the Viscounty asunder, true heroes seek answers to questions that are not always black and white.

A one-round Verbobonc Regional adventure for [character levels] level 1 - 10.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211285.name: Reclamation
211285.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A well-known merchant rumored to have shady dealings requests your assistance in the recovery of some missing goods.

This is a one-round Verbobonc regional adventure with both role-playing and combat elements for [character] levels 1 - 12.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211286.name: The Ties That Bind
211286.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The marriage is done and now it is time to heal the wounds. Lord and Lady Milinous have invited their subjects, renowned adventurers and loyal retainers to join them in Cienega Valley during the week-long Brewfest holidays to finally celebrate the union of two houses.

This is a Verbobonc regional adventure for character levels 1 - 13.

[Characters] with Infamy from House Milinous or House Asbury cannot play this adventure.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211287.name: Ride the Merchant's Highway
211287.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Ancient magical energy slumbers in hidden points around the Viscounty, waiting to be awakened. Do you dare to brave a path none have tread for centuries? This is adventure two of five in the Skyroad Series, which should be played in order.

A one-round Verbobonc regional adventure for [player characters] levels 1 - 8.

211288.name: J'Accuse! - The Inspector
211288.description:
A single card expansion for J'Accuse!

The back of the card includes instructions for game variant #2, which changes the victory conditions.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211289.name: Crewel Intentions Part One
211289.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Special

From the introduction:

A chance encounter with a young apprentice seamstress leads you to finish an adventure that began fifty years ago. A powerful adventuring party finding an indecipherable map that leads to a lost trove of indescribable treasure is the stuff of legends. Now you will see how legends are made into reality... or at least you'll die trying.

This is Part One of a two-round Verbobonc regional special for characters levels 1 - 10.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211290.name: Crewel Intentions Part Two
211290.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Special

From the introduction:

After half a century an indecipherable map has lead you to an uncharted island in search of an unknown treasure! Dark figures oppose you as you race to be the first to face the deadly secrets of this treasure trove.

This is the second part of a two round Verbobonc regional special for characters levels 1 - 10.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211291.name: Paper Chase
211291.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

Betham the Sage – scholar, librarian, and proprietor of the legendary bookstore of Verbobonc City has put out a call for adventures. The task? A unique opportunity, that’s for sure.

This is a two-round introductory adventure for first level characters only.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211292.name: Forest for the Trees
211292.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

For thirty years the residents of Hommlet have seen heroes and villains come and go. As you spend a quiet day at the Inn of the Welcome Wench, you can’t help but wonder if there might be an adventure here for you.

A two-round continuous play Verbobonc Introductory adventure for first level characters only.

211293.name: Cleanse Thy House
rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211293.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Church of Trithereon is accused of fermenting sedition against the lawful nobility of the land. To address these accusations, Bishop Haufren has called an emergency session of the Council of Abbots in the town of Swan. But the Church of Trithereon is distrustful of the good bishop’s agenda, and House Langmuir has a few issues of their own to address.

This is a one-round Verbobonc regional adventure for character levels 1 - 10.

WARNING: This adventure contains spoiler information for Year 6 regional adventures. [Characters] should have played all Year 6 Verbobonc regional adventures prior to this adventure.

211294.description:
A fearsome foursome of kooky knights. A promotional set of Munchkin Knights. A ziplock bag containing four knight cards for Munchkin with a fifth card detailing the publisher's information.

The four knights are: Level 1-Weak Knight, Level 6-Sir Plus, Level 8 - One Knight in Bangkok, Level 10 - Santa, Silent Knight.

Originally included in Game Trade Magazine #200.
211294.name: Munchkin Knights: Four More

211295.name: Storm the Dragon's Bastion
rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211295.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Skyroads have the potential to bring wealth and power to those who control them. Rumors say that Lord Shannus of Glory refuses to participate. A new ally asks you to accompany him on a mission of diplomacy - or more - into the Iron Wood. This is adventure three of five in the Skyroad Series, which should be played in order.

A one-round Verbobonc regional adventure for character levels 1 - 8.

211296.name: Mourning Glory
rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211296.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The disappearance of a Mounted Borderer detachment in the Iron Wood has raised concerns that something is afoot in the town of Glory. You’ve been asked to take a discrete look around and see what you can find out.

A one-round Verbobonc regional adventure for PCs level 1 - 11.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211297.name: Hidden Within Halls of Iron
211297.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

While rumors of haunted halls continue, rampant mischief goes unaddressed and the orderly way of life in the Dwarven tunnels tatters away like a forgotten battle-standard. Hoping to find solutions to the growing mysteries, a private council of concerned residents in the town of Irondelve seeks to recruit trustworthy investigators to help rescue the citizens from themselves. What secrets will the intrepid adventurers find, and what could possibly lay... Hidden within Halls of Iron?

A one-round Verbobonc regional adventure for characters level 2 - 12.

211298.name: The Lion and the Dragon
rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211298.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

From Loren’s Ford, a combined army of House Avgustin, Stefania, and Chondell soldiers marches toward Validia in a united show of force against the Lord of the Iron Wood. Field Marshall Yronl has not given up on a diplomatic solution, but as the army grows closer, new developments make armed conflict seem unavoidable. Could this be the beginning of civil war in the Viscounty?

A challenging Verbobonc regional adventure for [character] levels 1 - 11.

211299.name: The Swan and the Crow
rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211299.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Covert agents seek to undermine power in the beleaguered town of Swan. Adventurers are enlisted for aid, and the heir of a noble house finally comes of age to help determine the future of the Viscounty.

A Verbobonc regional scenario for [character levels] 4 - 10.

211300.name: A Bitter Pill
rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211300.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Fame. It can be a double-edged sword. With the Viscounty on the brink of civil war a chance to alleviate some of the tension-and line your pockets-presents itself. But what is best for the Viscounty may be in the eye of the beholder.

A one-round Verbobonc regional adventure set in Verbobonc City and possibly the Ironwood for [characters] level 1 - 10.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211301.name: Race the Spirit's Lightning
211301.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Verbobonc has changed dramatically since Magister Har sent you on a simple mission years ago. Enemies have become allies, and allies now seem untrustworthy. Triangles of lightning flash in the sky. Are these omens of doom, or heralds of a powerful transfiguration? Find out what lies at the end of the road to adventure.

This is the final adventure in the Skyroad Series, which should be played in order. [Characters] with Gnomish Spectacles are encouraged to play.

A one-round Verbobonc regional adventure for character levels 2 - 12.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211302.name: Jinxed
211302.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

One day, years from now, you’ll be talking with friends about unlucky times. “I once had a very unlucky day,” you’ll tell them. “It started right away, first thing in the morning. It might have seemed lucky at first. It certainly did to me. But bad luck comes in many guises.” “Well, then,” your friends will say, “Tell us all about it.”

A one-round investigative Verbobonc regional adventure for character levels 1 - 8.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211303.name: Small Souvenirs
211303.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

An earnest plea from a small homesteader leads deep into the Gnarley Forest to reclaim a treasured memento.

A one-round introductory adventure for 1st level characters set in the Viscounty of Verbobonc.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211304.name: Mediation
211304.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A simple escort job takes an unexpected turn and you learn that gathering information is more than just buying a few rounds at the local tavern.

A one-round Verbobonc adventure for questioning characters level 2 - 14.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211305.name: Crypt Things
211305.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

After a year in a magical coma, it is clear that Bishop Haufren is dying. One desperate quest into a lair of forgotten evil may be enough to save him, but the secrets unearthed there could have a life of their own.

A one-round Verbobonc adventure for PCs level 2 - 14.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211307.name: Darkness is Unbound
211307.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Shannus of Glory seeks adventurers willing to prove that his violent actions in the past year have been justified. Has the Great Dire Dark truly returned to the Iron Wood? And if so, who other than Shannus can contain it?

A one-round Verbobonc adventure for [characters] level 4 - 14.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211308.name: Bred in the Bone
211308.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

'What is bred in the bone will out in the flesh.' A race to save an innocent young woman from the depredations of a madman reveals a plan for revenge as old as the gods.

A one-round Verbobonc adventure for PCs level 4 - 14.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211309.name: Quisling
211309.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Verbobonc is only as strong as its heroes, and only as wise as its leader. When the true power behind the throne is revealed by a prophetess in the Gnarley Forest, will the PCs survive to uncover the truth? Will the truth set the Viscounty free, or topple it into chaos?

A one-round Verbobonc adventure for PCs level 2 - 14.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211310.name: Noble Ambitions
211310.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The true power rises to claim the Viscounty of Verbobonc as his own. Only a handful of secrets, carefully collected by the heroes of Verbobonc, provide the power to stop him. Now the time has come to battle your way to the schemer before his well-laid plans come to fruition.

A one-round Verbobonc adventure for [characters] level 4 - 15 and the ultimate adventure in the Verbobonc region of Living Greyhawk.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211311.name: Assault on Castle Greyfist
211311.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Interactive Adventure

From the introduction:

Secrets are revealed, and the battle lines are drawn. The time has come to force the villain's hand. As the sun sets on the Viscounty, Verbobonc City is engulfed in the flames of war, pitting brother against brother in a desperate battle of epic proportions. The Prophecy shall be fulfilled...

A one-round Verbobonc battle interactive for characters level 4 - 15, and of special interest to characters closely tied to the Verbobonc regional campaign.

User summary:

This is an interactive (semi-LARP) adventure. It was distributed as a 69-page PDF scenario and three "stat block" supplements: a 16-page PDF for Levels 6 - 8; a 23-page PDF for Levels 10 - 12; and a 16-page PDF for Level 14.

rpgseries: VTF - Living Greyhawk Velverdyva, Tuflik, and Fals Trade Route Meta-Regional Adventures
VTF6 - Velverdyva, Tuflik, and Fals Trade Route Season Six
211312.name: Autumn
211312.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk VTF Meta-Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The elf clans continue to migrate to the western forest while elements of the Gnarleyfolk begin to adopt a more radical view toward the orcish threat. Life is like the changing seasons they say, and winter is coming to the forest.

A metaregional adventure set in the village of Ketter’s Hearth in the Viscounty of Verbobonc and a stage of The Gnarley Threat, for [character levels] 4 - 16.

NOTE: Characters participating in Verbobonc regional adventures are recommended to play this adventure after VER6-01: The Discontent of our Winter and before VER6-05: Reclamation.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211313.name: The Viscounty of Verbobonc
211313.description:
From the introduction:

Verbobonc is a near-independent province of the Archclericy of Veluna, ruled in palatine by a powerful viscount. Her borders range from the Velverdyva River across the northern border, reaching south and entering the Kron Hills. Her eastern borders lies somewhere within the Gnarley Forest. The Ironwood marks the viscounty’s western border with that of Veluna.

211314.name: Verbobonc City
211314.description:
From the introduction:

This document is intended as a reference guide to the City of Verbobonc. This is not an adventure in itself. Since Verbobonc is the only large city in this section of the Flanaess, and this area is a launching point for many adventures (Return to the Temple of Elemental Evil, etc), I foresaw the need for [player characters] to buy and sell magical or rare equipment, purchase spells, gather information, find a warm inn, etc.

User summary:

This fan-made product was widely circulated among participants in the Living Greyhawk Verbobonc regional adventures. It is derived primarily from published sources but also presents some unique (non-canonical) materials.

211315.name: Journal of the Wanderer
211315.description:
The Wayfarer's Guide to Verbobonc

From the introduction:

Long before the coming of humanity, Verbobonc was an elven settlement set on a wooded hilltop overlooking a spot where a minor tributary, Gillendyl’s Run, enters the Velverdyva River’s wide expanse. The small river town featured an impressive elven tower fortress surrounded by yet more tall, thin towers, narrow walkways, lofty ipt-houses, and parkways illed with delicate wood and ceramic statuary. Considered a safe haven on the great river, a market place developed along the riverbank attracting goods from near and far.

User summary:

This item provides background and setting development for the Viscounty of Verbobonc on Greyhawk. It was created by the Verbobonc Triad and Verbobonc Council (the formal organizations charged with, respectively, creating and running the Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional play program) - but it was not published by Wizards of the Coast. It was intended to function as a free resource to introduce and orient players to the Verbobonc region.

rpgseries: VER - Living Greyhawk Verbobonc Regional Adventures
211316.name: Death & Heroic Deeds
211316.description:
From the introduction:

This document is intended as a regional supplement to the Living Greyhawk Rules Update 3: Adventure Certificates. Contained within are regional modifications and clarifications that apply to open item purchases in the Verbobonc region of the Living Greyhawk Campaign (which corresponds to the real-world US state of Illinois and Indiana). You should have a copy of RUP3: Adventure Certificates on hand to reference when reading this document.

User summary:

This document was used as formal rulings and precedents during the Viscounty of Verbobonc organized play (part of Living Greyhawk). However, it was not published by Wizards of the Coast.

211317.name: Superdimension Neptune VS Sega Hard Girls
videogamehonor: 2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best PlayStation Exclusive Game of the Year Nominee
211317.description:
User Summary

You will be able to explore dungeons including being able to crawl through spaces.

211318.name: A Quiver of Crows
211318.description:
A twin-stick shmup set in a grim world cursed by demons and ghouls.

Source: The Game Website.

211319.name: Vision Runner
211319.description:
Vision Runner is a First Person Parkour game with an In-Game map editor. Build and Share your parkours or play parkours from other players.

Source: The Developer Website.

211320.name: Wild Romance
211320.description:
Unhappy with his life in Tokyo, Kazuma returns to his hometown in the Japanese countryside where he reconnects with four classmates. When the girls accidentally reveal that they are not mere humans, a journey of discovery and constant flirtation begins.

Source: The Game Website.

211322.name: DungeonPig
211322.description:
Description from the designer:

Enter the craziest dungeon ever existed, catch the magical pig, bring it to your base and make your team win!
DungeonPig is a humorous fantasy boardgame for everybody!

Two (or more) teams face each others in this funny, fast paced and crazy game, entering the classic dungeon filled with traps and danger!
The aim of the game is to catch a magical pig and return it to your base before the other team. Each turn you can move, exploring new areas and trying to avoid traps and curses, attack opponents, try to catch the scared pig and use your unique special abilities to prevail.
But be careful: the magical pig can transform itself in various dangerous forms (even in a dragon with a cold!) and some curses may force you to do really weird things...
You never know what to expect in a DungeonPig game!

211323.description:
Im Wandel der Zeiten: Das Kartenspiel is the German edition of Guns & Steel. The German edition contains both Guns & Steel and Guns & Steel: Renaissance.

Game description for Guns & Steel:

Technology is a double-edged sword.

We have grown accustomed to the comforts of civilization, but at the same time we are always creating bigger bloodier methods of destruction.

Will you focus on civil developments to speed up production, or will you build powerful armies to lay waste to your enemies?
Do you build wonders that leaves a permanent heritage for mankind, or do you want to seize it from those who are not worthy?

Guns & Steel combines the variety of hand building with a unique card flipping mechanism, and enables 2-4 players to compete throughout the ages, struggling to build the greatest empire of the world.

Enjoy a tightly packed strategy game that will force you to make challenging decisions on every turn, and experience the rise & fall of nations in just an hour's time.
211323.name: Im Wandel der Zeiten: Das Kartenspiel

211324.name: Town: Tavern & Town Guard
211324.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modular Kit: Town - Tavern & Town Guard is a printable dungeon tileset compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone set, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Modular Kit: Town - Tavern & Town Guard comprises 5 different tiles that can be printed multiple times and arranged in limitless combinations with maps from the Modular Kit: Town range.The buildings included in this set are:

Tavern (10x6 squares), with cellar (10x6) squares)
Town militia guardroom (10x6 squares), with basement prison jail (10x6 squares) and barracks/mess room (10x6 squares)




Included:

Gridded and Griddless 300dpi versions on A4 pdf
A set of 300dpi full size png files, for poster printing or VTT.

211325.name: Ghostly Disguise
211325.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spell Power: Ghostly Disguise includes a handful of new feats for fans of the ghostly disguise spell, plus plot hooks to bring your adventurers in quickly using this spell and these feats!

Feats include Deathly Disguise, Ethereal Disguise, Fearsome Disguise, Invulnerable Disguise, and Otherworldly Disguise! The plot hooks wrapped around ghostly disguise include a crafty illusionist, clever war-mages, a very savvy ghost, and a sorcerer in an ancient ruin!

211326.name: The Shapeshifter's Handbook
211326.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Shapeshifter's Handbook is an expansion to the Alteration sphere from the Spheres of Power magic system. Inside these pages you’ll find new talents, new feats, new racial abilities, new incantations, and GM information for making the most of alteration magic in your games.

211327.name: Hybrid Class: Possessed
211327.description:
From publisher blurb:

Invite Me In ...

Some characters choose a path of sword training, apprenticing with a magic user, studying in the echoing halls of a decrepit temple. Some acquire experience in a less traditional way. Some are chosen for greatness by hostile entities, or dead spirits, or alien minds. Those are the Possessed. The power is considerable, but comes with a weighty price.

211328.name: Paladin Spells IV (3PP)
211328.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Paladin Spells is a simple document that collects the paladin spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 4th-level paladin spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party content.

211329.name: Paladin Spells IV (PRD)
211329.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Paladin Spells is a simple document that collects the paladin spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 4th-level paladin spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

211330.name: Witch Spells IX (PRD)
211330.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Witch Spells is a simple document that collects the witch spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 9th-level witch spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

211331.name: Witch Spells IX (3PP)
211331.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Witch Spells is a simple document that collects the witch spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 9th-level witch spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

211334.name: Forest Encounters
211334.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Probably the most used terrain in a fantasy setting, the forest can be bright and vibrant or dark and dense, but should never be boring. In this document you’ll find resources to make your next forest encounter exciting:


Maps. Four 20x20 Forest Encounter maps with different terrain features, that can be combined into one large 40x40 forest map. As a bonus, there’s also a 30x40 Forest Road version of the map, that serves well for those pesky road ambushes. All maps have gridded versions.



Mechanics. Ideas and mechanics for creating exciting forest encounters, including an expansion on the Wilderness Hazards found in the Dungeon Master’s Guide.



Encounters. Two quick sample encounters that utilizes the forest environment to create an exciting encounter: a nighttime ambush in the dense forest, and a troll lurking by a river crossing. Finally, there’s an elaborate and detailed River Ride encounter, that has your party travelling down a dangerous river, while under fire by bloodthirsty pursuers.


User summary:

Distributed as a PDF document and twelve JPG map files (six locales with and without grids).

211335.name: Naval Battle of the Sino Japanese War
211335.description:
This is a Chinese wargame on the naval battle of the Sino - Japanese war 1894-1895. The components include 4 map, a set of counters, two dice, a rule book, two charts and three record table.
The game have four scenario: Fengdao’battle, Yellow battle, battle for Weihai and Yellow battle decisive battle. This is introduce naval wargame, easy to learn and easy to play.

211336.name: Fighting Railways
211336.description:
Description from the publisher:

Historical Board Gaming is excited to present Fighting Railways (FRR) - the railroad expansion for Global War-2nd edition. In this expansion you’ll find track markers to expand your existing rail lines plus armored trains and railway guns. building rail lines increases players ability to rapidly move troops across the map and also opens up new routes of lend-lease. Armored trains and rail guns allow for more and heavier firepower to be brought to a fight from a long distance.

211337.name: Secret Submarine Bases
211337.description:
Description from the publisher:

Welcome to Secret Submarine Bases (SSB), a Global War 1936-1945 (2nd Edition) expansion set. During the Second World War many nations operated hidden submarine bases in remote locations around the world. These bases were nestled in isolated coasts and sometimes even in Neutral counties.

What you set out to do in secrecy doesn’t always happen the way you plan it. Thus, what base an Alliance obtains is governed by a bit of randomness....as you will soon discover!

This expansion allows players to build secret submarine bases around the world. Because of their ability to hide, these bases can't be bombed while allowing you to extend the reach of your submarines around the world.

211340.name: U.K. & Japan Ordinance Set #2
211340.description:
Description from the publisher:

Welcome to Ordnance II! Our second Ordnance set features a number of new Japanese and British ordnance for use with Global War. Ordnance weapons are developed through technology research and expended during play to improve combat options.

The British player will enjoy the 20,000lb Grand Slam earthquake bomb – an excellent weapon for taking out German factories, shipyards and airfields. British ships will can arm themselves with Fairey-Stooge anti-kamikaze missiles and “Unrotated Projectile” anti-aircraft weapons. The homeland’s factories and bases will enjoy increased protection from the Z-Battery AA rocket system. British aircraft will find targets easier using RP-3 air-ground rockets.

Japan will find itself with new kamikaze weapons: the Ohka “Cherry Blossum” jet, Shinyo Suicide Boat and Kaiten Human Torpedo are powerful weapons for Japan to increase its kamikaze capacity and defend its shores. The A-11 ICBM and Fu-Go incendiary balloon bomb (designed to float across Pacific air currents) can both strike America from Tokyo!

The dizzying array of new weapons for Britain and Japan will add untold new strategy options and realism to Global War!

211341.name: Champions of Freedom
211341.description: Late in the war the United States developed a number of advanced weapon designs, many of which never made it past the prototype stage. Now its time to let these weapons loose on the battlefield. The Champions of Freedom Expansion allows players to use the plastic miniatures found in Amerika's Bring in the Heavies expansion in Global War 1936. This adds several new units for the US, Germany, and Japan to use in constructing their armies for world conquest.

211342.name: Glory of the Empire
211342.description:
Description from the publisher:

Late in the war the Japan developed a number of advanced weapon designs, many of which never made it past the prototype stage. Now its time to let these weapons loose on the battlefield. The Glory of the Empire Expansion adds plastic pieces and rules that allow the Japanese player to develop and use a variety of advanced weapons such as specialized planes and armor.

211345.name: Bonsai
211345.description:
User Summary

You water and clip a tree as it slowly grows.

211347.description:
Roll for the Galaxy: Terraforming Colony/Diversified Economy Promo Tile is a new mini-expansion tile for Roll for the Galaxy.


Terraforming Colony - A blue world with the ability: Gain $2 and a Novelty (cyan) good on this world when you place it.



Diversified Economy - Produce: At the end of this phase , gain +$ equal to the number of goods you produced on differently colored worlds.
211347.name: Roll for the Galaxy: Terraforming Colony/Diversified Economy Promo Tile

211348.name: Pexino: Vláček
211348.description: Innovative take on Memory with added strategic layer. Players are trying to find sets on the grid 10x9 of face down cards. But here they are not trying to find just two same pictures. Players can collect same colour of wagons or same purpose (postage wagons, coal wagons etc.), than add matching goods from hand (postage bags, coal etc.), they also need locomotive for every five wagons.

211350.description:
Four new temples with new costs (20 coins or 5 resources).
These were given as a promo when buying a copy of Deus: Egypt at Essen 2016.
211350.name: Deus: Promo Temples

211351.name: Shadowverse
211351.description:
User Summary

A digital collectible card game. It has a fun solo story mode as well as the ability to play online vs other players.

Set in a fantasy world with art in an anime style.

211352.name: Blade & Bones
211352.description:
A Tale lost in our past...

Discover a tale long lost in our past. Seven swords need to be found in this Metroidvania adventure where you will discover ancient secrets and fight with an intense combat system that rewards player skill and knowladge.

Lore – After Niro cried to create this world he did it again and created the Orins. Once they defy him and with furious anger he takes their voices away and the cause of the great sin... The first seven swords are forever lost in this world. To defy him again is necessary to find them but such a task can only be completed by the last seven Orins that still search for them.

Dynamic Combat – Using light and heavy attacks with precison and six different styles the combat system heavly relies on timing and patience and this intensive skill based system is supported by the procedural generation of swords and by a diverse range of enemies and bosses. Attacks blend together with a roll movement and the use of ancient relics as well as dynamic body transformations called Kuros that allow even more diverse gameplay.

Source: The Game Website.

211353.name: Giants and Reptiles
211353.description:
From publisher blurb:

Since the release of the first bestiary, the first monster book, there have been those who asked - can I play something exotic, can I play a monster instead of a regular character?

In this release of the Monster Classes series, you have the opportunity to play as FOUR different savage races - the hill giant, lizardfolk, troglodyte, or troll! As a member of these savage races, your experience playing in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game is sure to be unique and filled with unexpected situations.

This book includes four monster classes - the hill giant, lizardfolk, troglodyte, and troll, along with the associated feats necessary to build interesting characters, that at the same time are true to the concept presented in the Bestiary.

211354.name: Demolish & Build Company 2017
211354.description:
User Summary

Become a boss of Demolition & Build company. Destroy small wooden huts and huge concrete buildings. Manage your workers.

211355.name: HoPiKo
211355.description:
HoPiKo is an intense speed run platformer where you get to save gaming. Jump from platform to platform avoiding death, exploiting shortcuts and ripping through 100s of hand-crafted levels, each one dropped into a 5-stage mini run designed to break your mind!

Source: The Game Website.

211356.name: Threshold (Issue 13 - Oct 2016) A Crucible of Creatures
rpgissuearticle: Koskatep Level 11: Kalasah, The Black Hearth
The Unknown World Trail map - part I
Treatise on the History of Lycanthropy
Using Blackmoor in Your Mystara Campaign
211356.description:
A Crucible of Creatures

From the back cover:

Discover a multitude of creatures inhabiting Mystara! In this issue, you will find an expanded list of sentient beings, plus indepth coverage of lycanthropes, bhuts, and the undead.

Moreover, this issue includes articles on the past ages of Blackmoor and Hesperia, as well as a short single-player adventure for a Thief character and a new level of Koskatep, our recurring mega-dungeon.

211357.name: Pixel Gear
211357.description:
User Summary

Pixel Gear, a simple wave-based shooter in which you take on blocky enemies.

211358.name: Ships 2017
211358.description:
User Summary

Take control over 3 special purpose naval vessels. Complete various missions on dangerous waters of Baltic Sea.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211359.name: Archclericy of Veluna
211359.description:
From the introduction:

Veluna is situated in the center of the western lands of the Flanaess. The Velverdyva River marks our northern border with Furyondy. Veluna stretches west to the Fals Gap and east to the Iron Woods. The northern edges of the Lortmil Mountains mark our southern border and protect us from harsher weather seen in the land to the south. Veluna enjoys warm summers and mild winters with a long growing season, making farms common across the central and northern lands. There are only a few stands of forests left inside the boundaries of Veluna. The Asnath Copse is of Veluna and is home to the elven city of the same name. The Iron Woods marks the border between Veluna and Verbobonc, though where the border is in the woods depends on what patrol you run into while in the woods.

User summary:

This document served as a concise introduction to the Archclericy of Veluna for players involved in Living Greyhawk convention/tournament play. It includes character design restrictions.

211362.name: Archclericy of Veluna Gazetteer
211362.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome traveler to the Archclericy of Veluna. The heart and soul of Oerth. Inside these pages you will find a wealth of knowledge and information on this great land. From the shining lances and helms of the Knights of Veluna to the hallowed halls of the Great College of Veluna, from the beautiful tree-city of the elves of Asnath to the sprawling markets of Devarnish, Veluna has something that will catch the eye of one and all. The Archclericy is a shining example of what goodness and co-operation can achieve even in these dark times we live in.

User summary:

This item provides background and setting development for the Archclericy of Veluna on Greyhawk. It was created by the Veluna Triad and Veluna Council (the formal organizations charged with, respectively, creating and running the Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional play program) - but it was not published by Wizards of the Coast. It was intended to function as a free resource to introduce and orient players to the Veluna region.

211363.description:
A Saturn 5 Rocket miniature, hand painted, to use as First Player token.
Available for preorders at Essen fair 2012.
211363.name: 1969: Saturn V – Start Player Marker

211364.name: Seize the Bean
211364.description: In Seize the Bean, players take on the role of baristas who have quit their jobs to open their own cafés in the diverse city of Berlin, Germany. The goal of the game is for players to create the best café possible, measured by a variety of achievements such as financial success, café style, popularity, ratings, and coffee quality. The players do this by adjusting their shop stats, managing their resources, drawing customer cards, managing their shop queue, and playing various action cards.

211365.name: Veluna Meta-Campaign Sourcebook
211365.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Veluna Meta-Campaign Sourcebook.

Inside you will find the rules for a lot of things your [character] can do outside the game at the table. This document will go through changes and updates and your character must conform to the newest version of these rules at all times. If any changes are made we will make announcements on the lists below as to the changes and when they take affect.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211366.name: Mines of Austor
211366.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Adventure

From the introduction:

The High Roads Trade Company needs your help. A caravan has not returned from its trip to a remove silver mine, and the Company wants to send you to get to the bottom of the disappearance. An adventure based around the area southeast of Devarnish.

An adventure for characters level 1 - 4.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211367.name: Under the Streets
211367.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Adventure

From the introduction:

People in Devarnish are disappearing at an alarming rate. You have been gathered together by a veteran of many battles against evil. He believes that the cause of Devarnish's current suffering will be found in the sewers and catacombs beneath Devarnish.

This is a regional adventure for characters level 1 - 4.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211368.name: Poachers Will Be Shot
211368.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Festival of Crowfest is here and the streets of Valkurl are packed. Merchants from all over Veluna cram the streets as farmers sing praises to Beory and Merikka for a bountiful season. Wealth and goodwill are all around you but something dark lurks in the cracks. Someone is not what they seem but can the party find out who in time to save the town and themselves?

A dangerous adventure for character levels 1 - 4.

Border Run, Part 1.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211369.name: Which Way is the Water Flowing?
211369.description:
A Three-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The City of Falsridge has a water problem. Seems that travel on the expansive Fals River has stopped. For a city that makes a living by the water, this is bad. It seems that no matter what the city does, the river traffic doesn't return. It seems that whichever way the water is flowing, it is not toward Falsridge.

Part 1 of the Agent of Iuz series.

An adventure for character levels 1 - 8.

User summary:

This is Round 1 of the three-round Like Water Under the Bridge adventure.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211370.name: Over the River...
211370.description:
A Three-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The answer to the mystery of what is happening in Falsridge lies in the hands of an ancient sage. Why do answers always seem to cause more questions than they answer? you are once again in service of the city of Falsridge.

An adventure for character levels 1 - 8.

User summary:

This is Round 3 of the three-round Like Water Under the Bridge adventure.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211371.name: Borderline
211371.description:
A Three-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A boring caravan job takes an odd twist and thrusts the party into the limelight. Can the heroes of the day live up to expectations? Or will the troubled waters claim more lives?

An adventure for character levels 1 - 8.

User summary:

This is Round 2 of the three-round Like Water Under the Bridge adventure.

211372.name: Netherell: Epic Fantasy
211372.description:
From publisher blurb:

On Netherell, ships still rely on wind to fill their sails. Blacksmiths hammering at their forges produce the deadliest weapons which most of its population can imagine. Mounted knights, their armor allowing them to shrug off all but the luckiest arrow shots or spear thrusts, rule the battlefield. On Netherell, kings reign, peasants toil in the fields, and gods walk amongst them...

On Netherell, magic is real. Netherell has people who can call forth lightning and control the wind; who can shatter the minds of their enemies and summon demons to do their bidding. On Netherell, the dying, if left next to the right kind of tree, live on long after their bodies collapse into dust. Netherell's wildlife, monsters by the ken of those who live outside of this world, can devour souls, or breathe fire.

On Netherell, explorers from worlds beyond, galactics, work in secret to unravel its mysteries. Some do so out of curiosity. Others with the hope for profit or even honest patriotism. None of them, the scientists, traders, and soldiers looking for ways to exploit Netherell's unique features, dreams that solving its riddles could determine the fate of not only their distant home world but a thousand others as well.

On Netherell, a fuse lit at the dawn of history slowly burns...

211373.name: The Beast of Karridan's Hollow
211373.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Beast of Karridan's Hollow is a Traveller adventure for four to six characters. It's set in the small village of Karridan's Hollow in southeastern Dravelnar, a medieval kingdom on the world of Netherell.

Netherell, a planet shrouded in mystery is the home to powerful magicians (psionicists) and even more powerful natural forces. One of these is eating at the heart of the Kingdom of Dravelnar. Into this volatile mix the players are called on by a village elder to deliver them from a terrible beast, an ogre taking what it wants including many villagers as slaves. Its motives are unclear but it's obvious that if Karridan's Hollow is to survive the beast must be dealt with.

Are your players up to the challenge?

211375.name: Twilight Sector Setting Update Alpha
211375.description:
From publisher blurb:

So, you're new to the Twilight Sector, eh? You stepped off the Mistress of Orion and into the Gateway at Terra/Sol and you're wondering if you want to check the place out further.

Well, we here at Terra/Sol Games may have the answer.

In our first official Setting Update, we bring you a freeguide to our universe drawn from the material in the Setting Book and some of our online free downloads, put together in a convenient book form. The Galactic Timeline maps humanity's journey through the next millennium. The Stellar Nations gives you a succinct feel for the political climate, some color and smells if you will. A few other tidbits have been added, such as a brief sketch of the Transluminal drive and Character Generation alternate rules, to whet your appetite for some of our upcoming releases.

The Alpha Update includes input from our Insider Forum and our blog from the past year.

211376.name: Twilight Sector Setting Update Beta
211376.description:
From publisher blurb:

Setting Update Beta provides even more detail on the Twilight Sector Campaign Setting. Beta compiles the news from The Galactic News Service, The Star of the Plains and The Casual Observer Weekly Galactic News. Also included are expanded Slice of Life Articles on a variety of subjects as well as a first peak into the Hero's Park neighborhood of Kansas City on Terra/Sol.

All of this is liberally sprinkled with Adventure Seeds to help your Twilight Sector Campaign (or any other science fiction campaign) grow.

211377.name: Twilight Sector Setting Update #1
211377.description:
From publisher blurb:

The material contained in Setting Update #1 is not only suitable for the Twilight Sector Setting but for any Traveller game invloving high-density cities, clone technology, secret organizations and other common sci-fi themes.

This product will provide a further glimpse into the Twilight Sector and serve as a players guide for the Beyond the Open Door adventure campaign. Stripped of all the adventure specific information from Beyond the Open Door this product provides all the down and dirty background information that players will want to know.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211378.name: Leuko's Last Stand
211378.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

It seems your friends at the High Roads Trading Company have a proposition for you once again. They believe one of their business associates is working behind their back with the competition and want you to check it out. This is not a big deal usually, but when that competition is the Iron Rings Consortium you know all is not as it seems.

An adventure for characters 1 - 8 level.

rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
211379.name: Shipbook: Mirador
211379.description:
From publisher blurb:

Shipbook: Mirador details a 1000 ton Traveller compatible Starship. The ship is well detailed as a luxury passenger liner operated by Excelslor Tours (The Lady May and the Silver Spirit) and as a lab ship (The Rosalind Franklin) owned my the eccentric explorer Talia Mason.

The economics of owning a Mirador class ship are explored as well as plot hooks and NPCs. Come explore further into the Twilight Sector Setting in the Miradore.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211380.name: Fields of Peren
211380.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

After digging through stacks of dusty tomes your search for information about what you found on the ruined walls of the temple has brought you to Asnath. Home of the elvish court in Veluna, Asnath is a beautiful example of what humans and elves living together can do. Something dark lurks in its shadows though, and peace and harmony are not high on its list.

Part II of the Rings of Austor series.

An adventure for characters level 4 - 8.

211381.name: Techbook: Chrome
211381.description:
From publisher blurb:

Who wants some Chrome?

Terra/Sol’s Techbook: Chrome is an alternative take on Cybernetics for the Twilight Sector Setting. As usual Terra/Sol products, this material has been also been designed specifically to be useful for any Traveller game.

Within this book, you will find not only cybernetics of various kinds, but also bio-replacements (exact duplicates of missing limbs/organs) and bionics (altered biological parts), as well as cyborgs (brain in a jar riding around in robotic shells) and a new type of malleable cybernetic known as cyrgeware.

Revel in your Chrome!

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211382.name: The Delivery
211382.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A traitor has been discovered in the Veluna Guild of Messages and Missives. The security of the entire country is at risk, and you have the opportunity to catch the criminal. Can the country survive should you fail?

Part One of the Traveler's Saga.

An adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211383.name: Bodach Invasion
211383.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A village in crisis. Can you solve the mystery and turn the tide of the Bodach Invasion?

An adventure for characters level 3 - 8.

211384.name: A Simple Job (Pathfinder)
rpgseries: What Lies Beyond Reason Adventure Path
211384.description:
From publisher blurb:

It was supposed to be a simple job...

A strange merchant offers you a simple job – pick up and deliver cargo. You have three days to get it a mere fourteen miles through the city. How hard could it be?

A Simple Job is a journey through the city of Anduria, a cascading series of events that takes the heroes to explore strange locales and bargain with even stranger creatures. What secrets does the city hold, buried away for countless centuries?

A Simple job is an adventrue for 2nd level characters and is the first adventure for the What Lies Beyond Reason Adventure Path.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211385.name: The Dig
211385.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

An enterprising dwarf has designed a slaughterhouse-tannery in the mountains of Veluna. By selling only the choicest meats, and supplying a grand supply of hides, he hopes to turn his fortune into a title, but his actions are polluting the area, and getting the attention of adventurers. Add to this the fact that his father, an archeologist, has left a sizable skeleton in the closet, and you have an adventure.

An adventure for characters level 3 - 8.

211386.name: When Things Go Thump In The Wilderness...
211386.description:
From publisher blurb:

Halloween can be a time of family fun, costumed excitement, and sugar-fueled craziness. When you move into the realm of fantasy and semi-horror, it can become not-so-fun and more scary and terrifying. For Questing Heroes characters, harvest time and "Halloween" time can be dangerous and life-threatening.

Included in the Book are a few new monsters to use with your Questing Heroes games, as well as a new GMC, Rumplestiltskin, who can be either a useful ally or a horrible enemy.

211387.name: Terra NovUP
211387.description:
Terra NovUp it develops over several rounds, 9 or 12 depending on the game mode chosen, in their turn each player must make the best decisions to take off your StartUp.

Take charge of Distribution Channels, invest in your Customer Relationship collaborates with your strategic partners, control your costs to run activities or acquire resources, with them can develop Value Propositions for income customer segments.

At the end of the game the winner will be whoever gets the highest appraisal of your StartUp.

211388.name: Hexmaze
211388.description:
Hexmaze: a tile-based abstract strategy board game - Building a road has never been trickier

I. AIM

Be the first player to create a road between your home and the middle of the board by putting together hex tiles! That may sound really simple but it's harder than it looks!

II. SETUP OF THE GAME

Each player takes 4 hex tiles from the cloth bag and chooses his color. The youngest player starts and play continues clockwise.

III. HOW TO PLAY

Each turn, the player puts a hex tile on the board. It's important to note the following:
- at the beginning of the turn, you must hold 4 hex tiles in your hand
- your hex tile can be put wherever you want on the game board
- you can't pass on your turn
- two adjacent hex tiles must be connected to one another (see section V. for more details)

IV. SPECIAL HEX TILES

Special hex tiles (block, chainsaw, bomb, rotation and switch) can be used at any moment of the game. Thanks to them, you'll be able to change the course of the game.

211389.name: Carrie's Order Up!
211389.description:
User Summary

This arcade-style 2D game has you as a waitress serving tables and picking up plates. You have to complete orders on time and avoid colliding with customers. The story-line revolves around Carrie, the crablike waitress, and her aquatic customers. She seeks to gain more money to pay bills and unlock new features (like a vacation).

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211390.name: It's a Kinda Magic
211390.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A frightened and weary wizard begs your help in retrieving a powerful Tome from his insane master. Will you dare to enter this mysterious Spell Forge and recover this lost Tome?

An adventure for characters level 3 - 8.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211391.name: A Cup of Tears
211391.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

In a hidden monastery, sealed away by a powerful curse, lies a lost artifact. Will you put Veluna's welfare above your own to find the Cup of Tears?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 6.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211392.name: In Darkness Lurks
211392.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The city of Mitrick is the holiest city of Rao and the heart and soul of Veluna. Its marbled streets shine in the morning sun while the giant stained glass windows in the Grand Temple cast a kaleidoscope of colors over the city. It seems a local merchant has had some troulbe lately, and once again the church has called upon you to investigate. Why the church has called you in on this, you are unsure, but you can feel a storm brewing on the horizon though and the skies and the future are looking darker by the minute.

This is Part 3 of the Rings of Austor Series.

An adventure for characters level 3 - 10.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211393.name: The Spectre of Lorridges
211393.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The legend of Sancredia has awoken with a vengeance. In the village built on the grounds of his most ignominious defeat, people are being slaughtered. Is it some fearsome creature from beyond the realms of reality itself, or has a diabolical enemy sent a creature to transform these normally passive farmers into blasphemous monsters?

This is Part Two of The Traveler's Saga.

An adventure for characters level 3 - 10.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211394.name: The Catacombs of Mitrik
211394.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

You came to Veluna for the burial of a High Priest of Rao that was a part of the Flight of Fiends, but you didn't expect the Fiends to be a part of the procession!

An adventure for characters level 3 - 10.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211395.name: Under a Blood Red Sky
211395.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Finally Castle Sepher is complete and a grand celebration is being held for this occasion! The preparations are set and all the nobles and knights around the Vale gather to join in this spectacle. Everything has been prepared and all precautions have been taken to ensure a smooth gala. What could possibly go wrong?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 10.

Part 1 of the Paranoia and Deceit Series

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211396.name: The Return to Shandalanar
211396.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The heroes of Veluna know that Shandalanar is a town where the fields lie empty, where the worms rule, and where the Leviathan once called home. However, only a handful of people know of the dangers of Shandalanar and of the threat its very existence implies. The wizards, the clerics, and even the knights seem unaware that anything unusual is happening in Shandalanar, and there is only one way to prove them wrong. Will you return to Shandalanar?

An adventure for characters level 5 - 10.

Part 3 of the Traveler's Saga.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211397.name: What's Behind This Crate?
211397.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The museum of Mitrik is worried that something strange is going on in their basement storage area. People have been disappearing and no one who has ventured into the basement to investigate has returned. So it is the Lore Seekers that turn to some local adventurers to try to find out what is going on.

An adventure for characters level 3 - 10.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211398.name: Lost Secret of the Lortmils
211398.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

An old friend asks for your aid once more to search for two wayward friends. It seems they found an ancient tablet lost for centuries that turned out to be a map. Where this map leads however is a mystery and what might be found there could be the darkest secret Veluna has ever kept...

An adventure for character levels 5 - 12

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211399.name: The Wing of a Butterfly
211399.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The druids know that nature is in a very delicate balance. For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction. But, what they do not share is the fact that for every hurricane there is a single butterfly whose wing flapped and caused the breeze, which tipped the balance, creating the storm from the calm. What they do not even suspect is that, just as nature has its butterflies, so fate has hers.

This is part four in The Traveler’s Saga.

This is a one-round Living Greyhawk event designed for characters of [level] 2 - 10.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211400.name: A Family Affair
211400.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

News has come again that the town of Sugarberg is in dire straits. The High Roads Trading Company wants you to investigate robbery, as a few local businesses have been robbed of supplies and money. Is it a plague of Sancredia, little folk getting revenge, or a cutthroat thieves guild? Whatever it is it’s not the norm, but what is in Sugarberg? Time is short and tempers are high. Can you solve the mystery in Sugarberg?

A one round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional adventure for characters Levels 4 - 12.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211401.name: Shrouded in Mist
211401.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A light mist falls on the city of Whitehale as tensions remain high since the attacks on the villages near Castle Sepher. Sir Ellard Rojan still stubbornly denies help from Mitrik and yet has found nothing but dead ends and frustration. Can the Hextorites be that quiet?

Part 2 of the Paranoia and Deceit series.

For [character levels] 4 - 12

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211402.name: Eye Hand Coordination
211402.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

While traveling through Veluna a very peculiar boy runs up to your group yelling, "HELP! My home is being attacked and I can't wake up my mom." After that startling jolt from this boy your first question is to ask "Why us and How did you find us?" The reply was one you weren't expecting, "One of you is a Legendary Hero of Veluna aren't you?" the boy replies with a big smile.

A Follow-up adventure to the Catacombs of Mitrik.

It is recommended that [player characters] with the Veluna Legendary Mark of the Hero should play this event.

User summary:

For 4th - 12th level characters.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211403.name: Spire of Herion's Malice
211403.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Fals river rolls lazily westward through the Diocese of Falsridge. Flatbottom barges ply their trade from Mitrik to Thornwood and points west and though political tensions may be rising between the east and west the flow of money and travelers rolls on as always. Just north of where the Fals River crosses over into Bissel sits the little town of Quishern, a salt of the earth town that scratches out a living by lumbering the local forest for wood to send south to Delkellet. Its only notable feature is the huge looming landmark known as Krag Spire. It rises far over the valley that the little town calls home. All is not well in Quishern lately. Dark shadows creep throughout the town and the villagers are paralyzed in fear over what they want. Each night as the sunsets and the shadow of the spire stretches across town the same voice whispers from the darkness. "Give me what I want, give me my due, give me what I want, or the shadows shall consume you."

An adventure for [character levels] 4 - 12.

Part 4 of the Rings of Austor series.

This adventure is fully compliant with the new revised D&D Core Rules.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211404.name: Pixie in a Bottle
211404.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The curator of the museum of Mitrik is looking for some adventurers to do some field research into the origins of a mysterious object that was found in his basement.

Special Note: When arranging groups for this event please make an effort to only have one person with the sprite in a bottle (Listed on the cert as Curse of the Decrepit One) from the adventure VEL2-08: What's Behind This Crate?.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211405.name: Escape from Shandalanar
211405.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The bards of Veluna speak of a town where everything is horror. Horror and pain. A town from where there is no escape from the creatures that crawl on the crust of the land, from the lost and the hopeless and the broken and the doomed. The bards speak of a town and the name of the town they speak of is: Shandalanar. And, there can be no escape.

This is a Living Greyhawk adventure set in the region of Veluna and is appropriate for characters level 1 - 12.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211406.name: The Accursed Rings
211406.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Three rings forged from fire and metal unknown. Three rings that have stumped scholars for over a year as to what their true purpose is. One ring in the hands of the 'One' while two rings are held in two cities kept hidden away from even the most devout. Locked deep away with the Vale's best guarding them while Veluna's citizens go about their day... then it turns into night and the two rings begin the call...

For [character levels] 6 - 14.

It is recommended that at least some of the players have played in any of the Rings series, Paranoia and Deceit, and Lost Secret of the Lortmils before playing this module.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211407.name: Of Mines and Men
211407.description:
A One-Round Veluna Introductory Regional Living Greyhawk Adventure

From the introduction:

When four separate trading companies all claim ownership of the same mine, the feathers start flying. Especially when one of the most valuable veins of silver to be seen in recent years is discovered in it. The problem is, everyone has disappeared from the mines along with the deeds. Can you figure out what happened and who owns the mine? An introductory Veluna adventure for new characters.

Only 1st level Living Greyhawk characters may play this scenario.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211409.name: The Bishop's Gift
211409.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional [Introductory] Adventure

From the introduction:

A new bishop is being ordained in Mitrik. Many influential citizens wish to curry the political favor of this new authority figure in the Church of Rao.

An introduction to Veluna for first level PCs.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211410.name: Ad Populum
211410.description:
An Introductory One-Round Adventure Set in the Veluna Region for the Living Greyhawk Campaign

From the introduction:

A popular former Cleric of Rao has gathered pilgrims for a journey to the Circle of Hands. Will you protect the flock or turn the pilgrims against the Cleric, as the Church requests?

For 1st level characters only.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211411.name: Whispers in the Dark
211411.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Church of Rao has lost one of the rings and an ominous feeling has fallen over Veluna and the church. A bitter, dark winter has yet to let go of its icy grip even though Veluna yearns for spring to come early and bring new life to a distraught country. Unfortunately the darkness seems to follow you, as your presence in Veluna City is not one of goodwill but of mourning as another prominent Bishop has passed. All is not well in the Vale.

An adventure for [character levels] 6 - 12.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211412.name: Sins of the Father
211412.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

By tradition, the nobles of House Sarneth have shown in the past a tendency to step down when the eldest son is of age to rule properly. Redin Sarneth, eldest son of the most powerful noble in Veluna , Plar Eldried Sarneth, reached that age last fall. So far the Plar has shown no signs of relinquishing that power.

An investigative adventure in Veluna politics for [character levels] 2 - 8.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211413.name: War of the Rings
211413.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Rings of Austor are gone. The Diocese of Whitehale has been invaded, Castle Sepher and Whitehale City overrun. An ominous black cloud blankets the land, blotting out the sun while orcs, undead, and devils run amok. Armies muster in Mitrik against this unnatural enemy. War has come to the Vale of Luna, and the Archclericy needs the strength of heroes.

The conclusion to the Rings series and the Paranoia and Deceit Series.

A battle adventure for heroic volunteers [of levels] 2 - 16.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211415.name: Enemy of my Enemy
211415.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The forces of Evil hold the northern parts of Veluna. You have been called on by the Church of St. Cuthbert to help prepare for counter attacks against those forces. You have come to Falsridge because it is a safe place to plan and prepare, or is it?

A module for [character levels] 4 - 12.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211416.name: Heart of Darkness
211416.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The advance of the forces of evil has been halted. It is time to start planning counter offensives against their strongholds in Whitehale and Sepher. Are you up to sneaking past legions of orcs, undead, or worse to discover what darkness lies in a man’s heart?

An adventure for [character levels] 6 - 12.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211417.name: A Harvest of Souls
211417.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The shadow cast by The One continues to spread across Veluna, even as Hazen’s successor dons the mantle of Canon. In this struggle for the very soul of the Vale, heroes find that knowledge and wits are as valuable as swords and armor. How will you fare when put to the test? On the streets of Veluna City one battle will be decided for good or ill.

An urban investigative scenario for [character levels] 2 through 8.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211418.name: Behind Enemy Lines
211418.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

You received a message to meet Sheen Kriha in the Museum of Mitrik. The message said it was urgent that you report at once as you were recommended for a mission of the utmost importance in this time of need. With the armies of The One encamped around Mitrik what on earth could be important enough to draw you away from the defense of the walls?

For [character levels] 6 through 12.

Special Note: When arranging groups for this event please make an effort to only have one person with the pixie in a bottle (Listed on the cert as Curse of the Decrepit One) from VEL2-08: What's Behind This Crate? or from VEL3-07: Pixie in a Bottle.

rpgseries: VEL - Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventures
211419.name: Shadow of the Serpent
211419.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Veluna Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Diocese of Grayington has seceded from Veluna and the new Plar has declared himself the True Canon of the Faithful. All religions other than Rao are banned in Grayington, which remains untouched by the ravages of war.
